NineFingers.synopsis: CINE ARTIST - PLEASE CONTACT WRITER! (RUAIRI)The flow looks complex due to integration of an OM, but is relatively simple after the first stage.The first stage is always Nine-Fingers arguing with her underling Uktar, who always leaves before the first player QNs.After that, Jaheira's OM is prioritised, where Nine-Fingers tells her that Minsc is the Stone Lord. The Guild have set a trap to kill him, and she doesn't want Jaheira to interfere.After that, Nine-Fingers introduces herself to the player and can be asked questions about the city. If Jaheira's OM has not triggered yet, that takes priority on any subsequent meetings.

Bursar.synopsis: Uktar is a bursar for the Guild, Baldur's Gate's foremost organised crime outfit. He is humourless and self-important, nurturing a quiet grudge against Nine-Fingers and her blunt leadership style. Uktar asks the player to retrieve keys to Counting House vaults for him, and can provide a hint about where to find Minsc in return.He comments on the individual to whom each key we sell him belongs, which is the only time he shows true animation.

In one final edge-case they repeat the same mantra as a threat if Nine-Fingers is dead and we're taking over.We only learn any of this when Lady Ague herself explains the strangeness.

Zhent_Agent001.synopsis: Rugan will only appear in the Guildhall if we successfully rescued him and sent him on his way with the other Zhent in Act 1, shipment intact. He's not holding a drink, but is a little tipsy throughout. Merry drunk masking pain.He tells us how all those others were betrayed and executed in a Zhentish power play, and he only survived because he gave false evidence. We can convince him to leave the Zhent, at which point he'll head over to the bar and miss any combat.

AD_Zhent_Mercenary_004_Patrol_2.speaker: Gravedigger Karcen
AD_Zhent_Mercenary_004_Patrol_2.text: Keep your blades loose in their scabbards.

AD_Zhent_Mercenary_004_Patrol_7.speaker: Carlorina the Wolf
AD_Zhent_Mercenary_004_Patrol_7.text: Hey, I'm not the one snapping like a leather thong.

Visitor_005_63.speaker: Tut Thistlebog
Visitor_005_63.text: Welcome t'the Guildhall! Faerûn's finest festhall, s'long as you're not sober.
Visitor_005_63.context: NodeContext: Turning to player with a welcoming nod

Visitor_005_20.speaker: Tut Thistlebog
Visitor_005_20.text: That's my last one. Going home.

Visitor_005_21.speaker: Tut Thistlebog
Visitor_005_21.text: See - see - Nine-Fingers is a master of stratergic - strateegil - she's clever, Phos.
Visitor_005_21.context: CinematicNodeContext: Holding forth to his drinking buddy, absolutely pissed

Visitor_005_45.speaker: Tut Thistlebog
Visitor_005_45.text: Won't fight the Stone Lord out in th'open. But she's got a spot picked out, see, an'-

Visitor_005_19.speaker: Phostlethwaite
Visitor_005_19.text: Don't care about Stone Lord, Tut. Don't care about some ambush. I asked - d'you eat my last pickled ooze?

Visitor_005_14.speaker: Player
Visitor_005_14.text: Wait. I want to hear about the Stone Lord. Let him finish.

Visitor_005_15.speaker: Phostlethwaite
Visitor_005_15.text: Eh? Bugger off. I'm TALKIN' to my FRIEN' about an OOZE.

Visitor_005_83.speaker: Jaheira
Visitor_005_83.text: Now, now - he who keeps his manners keeps his teeth, too. Besides, you are only pretending to be as wine-soaked as your friend here.

Visitor_005_90.speaker: Phostlethwaite
Visitor_005_90.context: NodeContext: Rumbled - he'd been pretending to be drunk and was about to dispute being called out, but switches to hushed tones instead - has no idea how he was spotted so easily

Visitor_005_22.speaker: Jaheira
Visitor_005_22.text: I've been to fouler fest-halls than this. And you have the stage presence of a Volothamp Geddarm.
Visitor_005_22.context: NodeContext: Nonchalant - she doesn't rate this guy's acting skills

Visitor_005_32.speaker: Jaheira
Visitor_005_32.text: Now - you were speaking to my friend. Politely.
Visitor_005_32.context: NodeContext: Returning to topic, but sweetly reminding the thug of her threat if he's rude again

Visitor_005_86.speaker: Player
Visitor_005_86.text: Why are you pretending to be drunk?

Visitor_005_74.speaker: Narrator
Visitor_005_74.text: *Unlike his elder, the younger halfling - Phos - is stone cold sober. But for some reason, he's feigning drunkenness.*

Visitor_005_66.speaker: Player
Visitor_005_66.text: You're sober - so why are you pretending you're not?

Visitor_005_9.speaker: Phostlethwaite
Visitor_005_9.text: Back to sleep! Look, Tut here is an old friend of Nine-Fingers - saved her as a kid or some such, I don't know.
Visitor_005_9.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gestures at Tut, focusing on us - dropping the drunk act and speaking in hushed tones.NodeContext: Gestures at Tut, focusing on us - dropping the drunk act and speaking in hushed tones.

Visitor_005_35.speaker: Phostlethwaite
Visitor_005_35.text: But if I don't keep him busy like she asked, he's likely to run off and try to take on the Stone Lord himself.
Visitor_005_35.context: NodeContext: Hushed, urgent - we're going to get him in trouble

Visitor_005_7.speaker: Phostlethwaite
Visitor_005_7.text: So Tut's gonna tell you what he knows about the Stone Lord, you're going to leave us to our merry old time, and you're not going to put my name near any of this - yes?
Visitor_005_7.context: NodeContext: Hushed, barely-restrained impatience - laying out the terms by which he'll help in return for us leaving

Visitor_005_64.speaker: Tut Thistlebog
Visitor_005_64.text: Stone Lord, aye! Bastard's going after the Counting House - but he doesn't know that that's just another Guild operation. Heh.
Visitor_005_64.context: CinematicNodeContext: Jerking back to sudden consciousness as if he hadn't been falling asleep.NodeContext: Drunkenly finding a place in his story. Relish, slyly revealing that the Counting House is actually run by the criminal Guild

Visitor_005_62.speaker: Tut Thistlebog
Visitor_005_62.text: Nine-Fingers is gonna catch him with his claws in her coffers. I pity the bastard.
Visitor_005_62.context: NodeContext: Relish at the violent fate that awaits the Stone Lord.

Visitor_005_75.speaker: Jaheira
Visitor_005_75.text: The Counting House...? But what the hells could Minsc want there?

Visitor_005_33.speaker: Phostlethwaite
Visitor_005_33.text: Happy? Now - away wir ye. We wan' drink in peace.
Visitor_005_33.context: CinematicNodeContext: Happy is pointed to us, dead sober - then resuming his drunk act and shoooing us away

Visitor_005_91.speaker: Player
Visitor_005_91.text: Let's settle the matter of the ooze first, then. It's clearly important.

Visitor_005_37.speaker: Tut Thistlebog
Visitor_005_37.text: Didn't eat it. S'one way to prove it, if you really wan' help.

Visitor_005_42.speaker: Tut Thistlebog
Visitor_005_42.context: CinematicNodeContext: Tut leans forward and belches in our face.

Visitor_005_79.speaker: Narrator
Visitor_005_79.text: *An assailing mist dampens your face - stale beer, garlic, and whatever else lurks in Tut's stomach.*
Visitor_005_79.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player flinches from burp - using one of the NEGATIVE or HANDSUP_STOP reaction anims.

Visitor_005_41.speaker: Tut Thistlebog
Visitor_005_41.text: Hah! How y'like the smell of innocence? Bu' you're a good sport - so what was I sayin'?

Visitor_005_77.speaker: Jaheira
Visitor_005_77.text: The Stone Lord. And swiftly, please - I can only hold my breath for so long.
Visitor_005_77.context: NodeContext: Repressed disgust. We were just assaulted with a vile but genial belch.

Visitor_005_52.speaker: Narrator
Visitor_005_52.text: *As for the contents of your own stomach...*
Visitor_005_52.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player looks disgusted, and steps back from NPC

Visitor_005_92.speaker: Jaheira
Visitor_005_92.text: Must you embarrass me in front of the city's lower life-forms?
Visitor_005_92.context: NodeContext: Muted disgust - we just puked while interrogating a Guild member that she had intimidated.

Visitor_005_10.speaker: Tut Thistlebog
Visitor_005_10.text: Ugh! You're disgus- disgus-... You're a mess, mate.

Visitor_005_40.speaker: Player
Visitor_005_40.text: Waste any more of my time, and I will turn you into a pickled ooze.

Visitor_005_38.speaker: Tut Thistlebog
Visitor_005_38.text: No need f'such sauce, my friend. You're lucky I'm a happy drunk. Now - where was I?
Visitor_005_38.context: NodeContext: Drunkenly affronted, haughtily deigns to return to his story

Visitor_005_3.speaker: Tut Thistlebog
Visitor_005_3.text: Don't... don't... don't even know what that means.
Visitor_005_3.context: NodeContext: Unconcerned by our threat, drunkenly trailing off.

Visitor_005_43.speaker: Player
Visitor_005_43.text: I'm just here to listen to his fine man's tale about the Stone Lord.

Visitor_005_0.speaker: Tut Thistlebog
Visitor_005_0.text: See, Phos? This'un has RESPEC'! Now, where was I...

Visitor_005_78.speaker: Tut Thistlebog
Visitor_005_78.text: Ease off, eh mate? I don't even let Phos kiss me arse like that.
Visitor_005_78.context: NodeContext: He's drunk, but even he's embarrassed with how sycophantic the player is being.

Visitor_005_39.speaker: Phostlethwaite
Visitor_005_39.text: I never... I never asked him to.
Visitor_005_39.context: NodeContext: Phos, a little panicked, wanting to clarify with us that he never asked to kiss Tut's arse.

Visitor_005_44.speaker: Player
Visitor_005_44.text: I've got a tab running at the bar. Indulge me and I'll keep it open, just for you.

Visitor_005_48.speaker: Tut Thistlebog
Visitor_005_48.text: You. You are a very beautiful person.
Visitor_005_48.context: NodeContext: Utter sincerity. He'd adopt us if he could.

Visitor_005_2.speaker: Tut Thistlebog
Visitor_005_2.text: I can buy m'own bloody drinks, thanks.

Visitor_005_30.speaker: Phostlethwaite
Visitor_005_30.text: Managed to keep out of the worst of the fighting. Now just need to keep from sobering up.

Visitor_005_34.speaker: Phostlethwaite
Visitor_005_34.text: Can't lie. It's a relief to have that old fart off my hands.

Visitor_005_67.speaker: Phostlethwaite
Visitor_005_67.text: He's all riled up. Best you do g'way.
Visitor_005_67.context: NodeContext: Drunken tone, apologetic for his friend

Visitor_005_55.speaker: Tut Thistlebog
Visitor_005_55.text: D'ya see? I killed ten of 'em, without even droppin' me mug.

Visitor_005_57.speaker: Tut Thistlebog
Visitor_005_57.context: NodeContext: drunk, squinting up at us - looking for his friend, but too drink to care that much

Visitor_005_88.speaker: Tut Thistlebog
Visitor_005_88.text: Heard it, one of Glitterbeard's lads tellin' tales! The Stone Lord got 'et by a mimic, and bust his way clean out!

Visitor_005_81.speaker: Phostlethwaite
Visitor_005_81.text: Right, Tut. I think you've had enough.

FetchersBrat_002_6.speaker: Sticky Dondo
FetchersBrat_002_6.text: Fetcher isn't himself, so I'm running the shop. You buying or selling?

FetchersBrat_002_4.speaker: Player
FetchersBrat_002_4.text: And where do you get the items you sell?

FetchersBrat_002_3.speaker: Sticky Dondo
FetchersBrat_002_3.text: Let's just say the previous owners no longer have a use for them. Got me?

FetchersBrat_002_1.speaker: Player
FetchersBrat_002_1.text: Maybe a bit of both. Show me what you've got.

FetchersBrat_002_5.speaker: Sticky Dondo
FetchersBrat_002_5.text: Sometimes stuff we sell comes back around to us again. So watch yourself. Got me?

Bursar_Guard_002_0.speaker: Elliot
Bursar_Guard_002_0.text: Banners change, business stays the same - talk to Uktar.

Bursar_Guard_002_1.speaker: Elliot
Bursar_Guard_002_1.text: You need to get up early indeed to get one over on Nine-Fingers. If she were easily toppled, Uktar would've done it already.

Bursar_Guard_002_3.speaker: Elliot
Bursar_Guard_002_3.text: You want a chat, go prop up the bugbear's bar.

Bursar_Guard_002_4.speaker: Elliot
Bursar_Guard_002_4.text: Pay no mind to the perfumes - just Uktar's Amnian scents. Better than what they're masking, believe me.
Bursar_Guard_002_4.context: NodeContext: OHM-nian - from the city-state of Amn

Bursar_Guard_002_5.speaker: Elliot
Bursar_Guard_002_5.text: Nine-Fingers gone, and the Zhentarim along with her. Worked out neatly enough for you, didn't it?
Bursar_Guard_002_5.context: NodeContext: Appraising - you think the player has orchestrated all this chaos and bloodshed in their favour.

Bursar_Guard_002_7.speaker: Elliot
Bursar_Guard_002_7.text: It's Uktar you want - old Silver-Smile there.

Bursar_Guard_002_8.speaker: Elliot
Bursar_Guard_002_8.text: If it's Uktar you're after, he's in with the guildmaster. Not even Nine-Fingers Keene can escape the great balancing of Guild books.
Bursar_Guard_002_8.context: NodeContext: Vaguely amused at his superior's insistence on doing accounts no matter what's going on

AD_Member_004_BackWithbarkeep_0.speaker: Cheeky Nora
AD_Member_004_BackWithbarkeep_0.text: Hee hee! I guess I am Severn's type after all!

Visitor_004_0.speaker: Floridor
Visitor_004_0.text: Don't care who sits in the big chair - I'm not wearing any Zhentarim colours.

Visitor_004_1.speaker: Floridor
Visitor_004_1.text: Careful around the Steel Watch. The old guard gave thieves a slap on the wrist, but those bolted bastards will rip off the whole damn arm.

Visitor_004_2.speaker: Floridor
Visitor_004_2.text: Zhentarim won't make the thieving work any easier - wait 'til you see the commission they take.

Visitor_004_3.speaker: Floridor
Visitor_004_3.text: They're saying the Steel Watchers just fell flat where they stood. Let some other bugger try to strip them for parts.

Visitor_004_4.speaker: Floridor
Visitor_004_4.text: May Mask cast his cloak on you. An honest thief needs all the cover she can get these days.

Member_006_0.speaker: Babyjowls
Member_006_0.text: You're looking a little lost. You want my advice? Leave this place and get lost for good.

Member_006_1.speaker: Babyjowls
Member_006_1.text: You're in charge here now? I hope you at least get some of the filth dumped over the side.

Member_006_2.speaker: Babyjowls
Member_006_2.text: You know what else? No, never mind, because you don't care. I can see it in your eyes.

Member_006_3.speaker: Babyjowls
Member_006_3.text: I guess the more things change, the less they change - or something like that, eh?

Member_006_4.speaker: Babyjowls
Member_006_4.text: One thing that hasn't changed - this place is still a dump.

Member_006_5.speaker: Babyjowls
Member_006_5.text: Change or no, this place is still a dump. You know I'm right.

Member_006_6.speaker: Babyjowls
Member_006_6.text: So, under new management - but how far under? If you know what I mean.

Member_006_7.speaker: Babyjowls
Member_006_7.text: Look at this place. It's filthy! The Guild isn't what it was in my mother's time.

Member_006_8.speaker: Babyjowls
Member_006_8.text: The Stone Lord will really be breathing down our necks now.

Member_006_9.speaker: Babyjowls
Member_006_9.text: Seems like something rotten went down in the Counting House. Ol' Nine-Fingers didn't get her way for once, as I hear it.

Zhent_Mercenary_007_0.speaker: Smilin' Ginna
Zhent_Mercenary_007_0.text: Bit of a let-down, this place.

Zhent_Mercenary_007_1.speaker: Smilin' Ginna
Zhent_Mercenary_007_1.text: You'll see. No place as clean and tasteful as a Zhent-run bar, so long as you have the coin.

Zhent_Mercenary_007_2.speaker: Smilin' Ginna
Zhent_Mercenary_007_2.text: This is supposed to be the greatest festhall under the city - so where's all that bloody fun?

Zhent_Mercenary_007_3.speaker: Smilin' Ginna
Zhent_Mercenary_007_3.text: Now the dust's settled, I might see about setting up in the tavern there. Plenty of potential once you clear the bodies out.

Bodyguard_003_1.speaker: Lady Croup
Bodyguard_003_1.text: A charm, of course. And then you'll do it yourself.
Bodyguard_003_1.context: NodeContext: Matter of fact, stating how she'd kill us is she had to - an intimidation game played by her elite unite of bodyguards.

Bodyguard_003_2.speaker: Lady Croup
Bodyguard_003_2.text: We serve her still, and so do you.
Bodyguard_003_2.context: NodeContext: Repeated like a loyal soldier's mantra.

AD_Zhent_Mercenary_001_Patrol_1.speaker: Slick Inatra
AD_Zhent_Mercenary_001_Patrol_1.text: I told our clients we'd be on our best behaviour. Everyone playing nice here?

AD_Zhent_Mercenary_001_Patrol_2.speaker: Slick Inatra
AD_Zhent_Mercenary_001_Patrol_2.text: Make sure the others keep to themselves. This place is jumpy - better to give the Guildies their space.

AD_Zhent_Mercenary_001_Patrol_0.speaker: Phase
AD_Zhent_Mercenary_001_Patrol_0.text: 'S not like we're bloody diseased, boss.

AD_Zhent_Mercenary_001_Patrol_5.speaker: Slick Inatra
AD_Zhent_Mercenary_001_Patrol_5.context: NodeContext: Jokingly, as if it's a dirty / scary word - she's well aware of her mercenary group's unsavoury rep.

AD_Zhent_Mercenary_001_Patrol_4.speaker: Phase
AD_Zhent_Mercenary_001_Patrol_4.text: The locals going to kick us out, sergeant?

AD_Zhent_Mercenary_001_Patrol_14.speaker: Slick Inatra
AD_Zhent_Mercenary_001_Patrol_14.text: Just you, Phase. You rob the place of its glamour.

AD_Zhent_Mercenary_001_Patrol_8.speaker: Phase
AD_Zhent_Mercenary_001_Patrol_8.text: No loss. Last time I was here they had dice, blood-bouts, the works. Now it's just a lot of sulking pickpockets.
AD_Zhent_Mercenary_001_Patrol_8.context: NodeContext: Getting a little serious, discontented.

AD_Zhent_Mercenary_001_Patrol_3.speaker: Slick Inatra
AD_Zhent_Mercenary_001_Patrol_3.text: Those sulks are paying us, Phase. So chin up, make your coin, and you can lose it somewhere else. Aye?
AD_Zhent_Mercenary_001_Patrol_3.context: NodeContext: Firmly laying down the law to a subordinate - she wants no trouble here.

AD_Zhent_Mercenary_001_Patrol_10.speaker: Phase
AD_Zhent_Mercenary_001_Patrol_10.text: What are we waiting for, Inatra? If we're meant to fight this Stone Lord, then let's bloody be about it.
AD_Zhent_Mercenary_001_Patrol_10.context:
NodeContext: Losing patience, calling superior by her first name. Bellyaching rather than anything dramatic.

Inatra = in-AHT-ra (long "ah" in stressed syllable)

AD_Zhent_Mercenary_001_Patrol_13.speaker: Slick Inatra
AD_Zhent_Mercenary_001_Patrol_13.text: See my uniform, Phase? It's nicer than yours, agreed? And not just because I don't sleep in it.
AD_Zhent_Mercenary_001_Patrol_13.context: NodeContext: Mild, laying down the law firmly

AD_Zhent_Mercenary_001_Patrol_15.speaker: Slick Inatra
AD_Zhent_Mercenary_001_Patrol_15.text: That's because I outrank you. So when I say that I haven't even been told our orders yet, I want you to believe me.
AD_Zhent_Mercenary_001_Patrol_15.context: NodeContext: Mild, laying down the law firmly

AD_Zhent_Mercenary_001_Patrol_11.speaker: Slick Inatra
AD_Zhent_Mercenary_001_Patrol_11.text: I'd also like you to bathe sometime this tenday.
AD_Zhent_Mercenary_001_Patrol_11.context: NodeContext: Softening her tone with the joke.

AD_Roah_AfterCoup_0.speaker: Roah Moonglow
AD_Roah_AfterCoup_0.text: Decide quickly, Guild-folk. Nine-Fingers, or all of you!
AD_Roah_AfterCoup_0.context: NodeContext: Calling out to Guild with threat / offer - she'll give the order to have them all killed if they don't hand over NF.

Visitor_001_1.speaker: Carnelia Vanthampur
Visitor_001_1.text: Ah, you did not see me. A peer of the Parliament openly walking the Guildhall would sell a few copies of Baldur's Mouth, I expect.
Visitor_001_1.context: NodeContext: Nervous - a politician politely worried they've been recognised in a den of thieves.

Visitor_001_2.speaker: Carnelia Vanthampur
Visitor_001_2.text: I'm sure my colleagues in Parliament will be happy to work with the Zhentarim. Nine-Fingers was, of course, a blight on our fair city.

Visitor_001_3.speaker: Carnelia Vanthampur
Visitor_001_3.text: The guildmaster wishes to keep me close. A representative from her friends in Parliament, during this time of upheaval.
Visitor_001_3.context: NodeContext: Nervous - you're trying to paper over the fact that you're a political hostage.

Visitor_001_4.speaker: Carnelia Vanthampur
Visitor_001_4.text: You seem to know these Zhentarim. You might... put in a good word?

Visitor_001_5.speaker: Carnelia Vanthampur
Visitor_001_5.text: Watching gods - Parliament has nothing on the power struggles down here.
Visitor_001_5.context: NodeContext: Nervous amusement - there's just been a bloody coup attempt in the Guildhall, to which you were a neutral party

Visitor_001_6.speaker: Carnelia Vanthampur
Visitor_001_6.text: It's well for everyone that Nine-Fingers prevailed. Parliament has spent years cultivating our... necessary friendship.
Visitor_001_6.context: NodeContext: Nervous relief - you're a politician, and the crime boss who has you in her pocket just won a bloody power struggle

Visitor_001_7.speaker: Carnelia Vanthampur
Visitor_001_7.text: Parliament stands ready to work with the next guildmaster. If that... is you?
Visitor_001_7.context: NodeContext: Nervously feeling us out - there's just been a bloody power struggle, and we're the only ones still standing.

AD_Visitor_005_CountingHouseTrap_0.speaker: Tut Thistlebog
AD_Visitor_005_CountingHouseTrap_0.text: Come on, Phos, another! Mouth's as dry as Uktar's bloody books.
AD_Visitor_005_CountingHouseTrap_0.context: NodeContext: Drunk, wheedling your friend into buying you another drink.

AD_Visitor_005_CountingHouseTrap_1.speaker: Tut Thistlebog
AD_Visitor_005_CountingHouseTrap_1.text: Guildmaster's buried worse than any foppin' Stone Lord.

AD_Visitor_005_CountingHouseTrap_2.speaker: Tut Thistlebog
AD_Visitor_005_CountingHouseTrap_2.text: No, I won't bloody hush, Phos. Told you - I know where the Stone Lord's headed. S'gonna be his grave.
AD_Visitor_005_CountingHouseTrap_2.context: NodeContext: Drunk, belligerent, waving off a friend who's trying to stop you talking about secret matters quite so loudly.

AD_Visitor_005_CountingHouseTrap_3.speaker: Tut Thistlebog
AD_Visitor_005_CountingHouseTrap_3.text: If we was any kind of Guildies, Phos, we'd look after this Stone Lord our own selves.
AD_Visitor_005_CountingHouseTrap_3.context: NodeContext: Drunk, rambling to a friend who may or may not still be there. A little belligerent on the notion that you want to go off and fight this crime boss who's threatening your guildmaster.

Visitor_003_0.speaker: Magpie Davys
Visitor_003_0.text: Oh... gods. Zhent are going to up the bloody protection rates, aren't they?

Visitor_003_1.speaker: Magpie Davys
Visitor_003_1.text: What's the point in paying the Guild for protection when they've pulled back all their crews? There's a bloody army coming.

Visitor_003_2.speaker: Magpie Davys
Visitor_003_2.text: May as well crack open a keg. That army's going to be on us any day now.

Visitor_003_3.speaker: Magpie Davys
Visitor_003_3.text: Zhentarim in charge - good! At least we know they won't be pushed around.

Visitor_003_4.speaker: Magpie Davys
Visitor_003_4.text: Nine-Fingers has lanced the Zhentish boil on her arse? Good - she can get back to protecting those who pay her for it.

Visitor_003_5.speaker: Magpie Davys
Visitor_003_5.text: Nine-Fingers is slipping. I'll tell her to her face. When... all of this is done.

Visitor_003_6.speaker: Magpie Davys
Visitor_003_6.text: If Keene can't deal with this Stone Lord, she should just make way. Sounds like his crowd can protect us.

Visitor_003_7.speaker: Magpie Davys
Visitor_003_7.text: Zhent dead. Keene dead. Who the hell's going to look out for us now?

AD_Bursar_Guard_001_AfterCoup_0.speaker: Snapbone
AD_Bursar_Guard_001_AfterCoup_0.text: Hah. All that fancy Zhentarim armour didn't stand up to much.
AD_Bursar_Guard_001_AfterCoup_0.context: NodeContext: Bravado - a fight has just finished in which you killed all the members of a mercenary group you'd been forced to share your space with. You're not impressed.

Member_004_10.speaker: Cheeky Nora
Member_004_10.text: Hm? Sorry, not now - need to find another way to make Severn notice me.

Member_004_29.speaker: Cheeky Nora
Member_004_29.text: Eyes off the barkeep, new blood. He and I, we're a thing. Were a thing. Will be a thing again.

Member_004_48.speaker: Player
Member_004_48.text: You're in love with the barkeep? The bugbear?

Member_004_54.speaker: Cheeky Nora
Member_004_54.text: Obviously! But he's my big bear.

Member_004_46.speaker: Cheeky Nora
Member_004_46.text: You clearly haven't met - you wouldn't soon forget a man like him. I know I can't.

Member_004_34.speaker: Player
Member_004_34.text: So what I'm hearing is - you were dumped.

Member_004_40.speaker: Cheeky Nora
Member_004_40.text: That is not what I said! We're just having... a break. A very short one.

Member_004_52.speaker: Player
Member_004_52.text: Why aren't you a thing right now?

Member_004_12.speaker: Cheeky Nora
Member_004_12.text: We're just... taking a breather. A short one.

Member_004_28.speaker: Cheeky Nora
Member_004_28.text: Only... I don't know why he broke things off. He said he had to - that Nine-Fingers forbade our love - but... well, I'm fairly certain she doesn't know I exist.

Member_004_51.speaker: Cheeky Nora
Member_004_51.text: Perhaps... he'll open up to you? He's such a soft heart, really connects with his customers. You'll see.

Member_004_57.speaker: Player
Member_004_57.text: I really, truly, could not care less.

Member_004_19.speaker: Cheeky Nora
Member_004_19.text: Oh, feign indifference all you want. You don't fool me - and you won't win him over that way.

Member_004_43.speaker: Cheeky Nora
Member_004_43.text: Go away. Love is dead, and I might as well be.

Member_004_47.speaker: Cheeky Nora
Member_004_47.text: Have you spoken to Severn yet?

Member_004_36.speaker: Player
Member_004_36.text: I will get right on that.

Member_004_32.speaker: Cheeky Nora
Member_004_32.text: Please, hurry. Every moment that passes is one we could spend... together.

Member_004_1.speaker: Player
Member_004_1.text: I have. Sorry, Nora - but you two aren't meant to be.

Member_004_20.speaker: Cheeky Nora
Member_004_20.text: But - what do you mean? He didn't say that!

Member_004_15.speaker: Player
Member_004_15.text: He's intimidated by you. Do yourself a favour and set your sights somewhere else.

Member_004_0.speaker: Cheeky Nora
Member_004_0.text: Ohhh, I told him I'd retired from the bounty hunting. I haven't killed a goblinoid in years.
Member_004_0.context: NodeContext: Frustrated - she and the bugbear have been over this

Member_004_21.speaker: Cheeky Nora
Member_004_21.text: Men. Monsters. Why are they all so bloody soft?

Member_004_22.speaker: Cheeky Nora
Member_004_22.text: Here. I was saving this, to woo him - but it doesn't matter now, does it? He can't see a good thing when he has it.

Member_004_9.speaker: Cheeky Nora
Member_004_9.text: Severn isn't scared. He used to love it when I told him of all the monsters I've slain.

Member_004_45.speaker: Cheeky Nora
Member_004_45.text: No, no - Severn will come around. He has to.

Member_004_49.speaker: Player
Member_004_49.text: He's a bugbear. The only date you two will go on is if he decides to eat you for dinner.

Member_004_39.speaker: Cheeky Nora
Member_004_39.text: He wouldn't. But if he honestly thinks I'd believe that, well... I suppose I've driven him to desperation.

Member_004_42.speaker: Cheeky Nora
Member_004_42.text: That is a stereotype. And an ugly one!

Member_004_26.speaker: Cheeky Nora
Member_004_26.text: Besides - Severn can't eat humanoid. Gives him a bellyache.

Member_004_24.speaker: Player
Member_004_24.text: It's me. Severn and I are in love.

Member_004_56.speaker: Cheeky Nora
Member_004_56.text: You back-stabbing minx. I suppose you want to fight now, heh? Bathe in one another's blood in Severn's name?

Member_004_38.speaker: Cheeky Nora
Member_004_38.text: Perhaps for someone else, I would. But my love for Severn is pure. Unsullied by violence.

Member_004_53.speaker: Cheeky Nora
Member_004_53.text: You? Please. He'd break you in half. So would I.

Member_004_18.speaker: Player
Member_004_18.text: Bugbears live short lives. It's destined for tragedy either way.

Member_004_41.speaker: Cheeky Nora
Member_004_41.text: So are all great loves. But if Severn finds it easier to wrap his heart in swaddling... well. I do not wish to cause him pain.

Member_004_4.speaker: Cheeky Nora
Member_004_4.text: Here. It was to be a gift to him - but it would only be a reminder of what could have been. You take it.

Member_004_33.speaker: Cheeky Nora
Member_004_33.text: All great loves end - all the more important that we use the time we have!

Member_004_7.speaker: Player
Member_004_7.text: Don't you have bigger priorities? Like the massacre that just took place?

Member_004_14.speaker: Cheeky Nora
Member_004_14.text: Bah. Politics. The only battlefield that matters is that of the heart.

Member_004_31.speaker: Player
Member_004_31.text: Don't you have bigger priorities? Like the massacre that just took place?

Member_004_16.speaker: Player
Member_004_16.text: Don't you have bigger priorities? Like the massacre that just took place?

AD_Bartender_Humming_0.speaker: Severn
AD_Bartender_Humming_0.context: NodeContext: A badly and quietly hummed version of the game's main song, "Down By the River"

Zhent_Mercenary_004_1.speaker: Gravedigger Karcen
Zhent_Mercenary_004_1.context: NodeContext: A gulping, respectful nod - we were present when Jaheira scared him and now he's frightened of all of us. 'Saer' is a gender-neutral title of respect - like sir / madam.

Zhent_Mercenary_004_2.speaker: Gravedigger Karcen
Zhent_Mercenary_004_2.text: Reckon I'll ask to keep a posting here. Good money-racket down in this old ruin.

Zhent_Mercenary_004_3.speaker: Gravedigger Karcen
Zhent_Mercenary_004_3.text: You did well to throw in with us. If Nine-Fingers had beaten one wave, well - there will always be another.

Zhent_Mercenary_004_7.speaker: Gravedigger Karcen
Zhent_Mercenary_004_7.text: D'you hear the Harpers were half wiped out? We should be sticking the last of their bleeding hearts, 'stead of guarding this place.
Zhent_Mercenary_004_7.context: NodeContext: Moaning about his boring posting.

Zhent_Mercenary_004_11.speaker: Jaheira
Zhent_Mercenary_004_11.text: The mood I am in, boy, I urge you to try.
Zhent_Mercenary_004_11.context: NodeContext: Quiet, but intensely fed up and threatening - responding to a careless Zhent who is boasting about killing Harpers. A sore spot for Jaheira.

Zhent_Mercenary_004_5.speaker: Gravedigger Karcen
Zhent_Mercenary_004_5.context: NodeContext: Intimidated and uncertain - he was talking shit about the Harpers without realising Jaheira was one until she spoke up. 'Ma'am' is a pleading addition in the hopes we won't get shivved.

Zhent_Mercenary_004_9.speaker: Gravedigger Karcen
Zhent_Mercenary_004_9.text: Zhentarim babysitting thugs. We're in Baldur's Gate - we should be out bullying Harpers and the like!
Zhent_Mercenary_004_9.context: NodeContext: Moaning about his boring posting.

AD_Zhent_LeaderBackup_TakeoverEasy_0.speaker: Trinoda
AD_Zhent_LeaderBackup_TakeoverEasy_0.text: Huh. Someone fulfilled our contract for us.
AD_Zhent_LeaderBackup_TakeoverEasy_0.context: NodeContext: A little bemused - you came ready for battle only to find the people you were paid to slaughter already slaughtered

AD_BossFriol_AfterCoup_0.speaker: Boss Friol
AD_BossFriol_AfterCoup_0.text: Job done. Tidy up, lads - the Guild let this place fall to rot. We Zhentarim won't do the same.
AD_BossFriol_AfterCoup_0.context: NodeContext: Calling out to group of soldiers after winning a battle. Grim satisfaction.

FetchersBrat_001_0.speaker: Li'l Fezmor
FetchersBrat_001_0.text: I'm busy doing a thing. Talk to Sticky.

Member_003_0.speaker: Cutter Violet
Member_003_0.text: Well - that was a little excitement, at least. Now who's going to clean up all the corpses?

Member_003_1.speaker: Cutter Violet
Member_003_1.text: You're in the guildmaster's good graces - nice spot to be, once you step right.

Member_003_2.speaker: Cutter Violet
Member_003_2.text: Maybe Nine-Fingers will add you to her Lady's Court. She's had stranger.

Member_003_3.speaker: Cutter Violet
Member_003_3.text: Ribbons' crew lost the sewer tunnels - that'll be the third crew the Stone Lord's pushed out this tenday.

Member_003_4.speaker: Cutter Violet
Member_003_4.text: You won't find much fun here today. Guildmaster's battened down the hatches 'til this Stone Lord problem's dealt with.

Member_003_5.speaker: Cutter Violet
Member_003_5.text: I give it a tenday before the Zhentarim have us marching around in uniform.

Member_003_6.speaker: Cutter Violet
Member_003_6.text: It's Keene I swore my blade to. Not that I lifted it to help her...

Member_003_7.speaker: Cutter Violet
Member_003_7.text: Wish I'd known that little melee was coming. Could've laid down a bet.
Member_003_7.context: NodeContext: A big battle just happened before her eyes, and she's disappointed she didn't turn it into a game.

AD_Roah_Combat_01_0.speaker: Roah Moonglow
AD_Roah_Combat_01_0.text: This could've been simple. Remember that!
AD_Roah_Combat_01_0.context: NodeContext: Mid-combat line, relishing in the fight

AD_Ninefingers_Combat_01_0.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
AD_Ninefingers_Combat_01_0.text: You could've been fat and happy. But fat and dead will do.
AD_Ninefingers_Combat_01_0.context: NodeContext: Mid-battle, grim disdain for the mercenaries betraying her

Member_007_2.speaker: Bad Twin Bubbins
Member_007_2.text: Bastarding Zhent. They hung my brother for a thief, up in Neverwinter. His mistake? Setting his sights on the same score.
Member_007_2.context: NodeContext: Absolute disdain for the Zhent

Member_007_3.speaker: Bad Twin Bubbins
Member_007_3.text: You won't catch me looting all that shiny Zhent armour. I'd rather go into battle bare-arsed.
Member_007_3.context: NodeContext: Absolute disdain for the Zhent

Member_007_4.speaker: Bad Twin Bubbins
Member_007_4.text: You can get near anywhere in the city from here without seeing daylight - once you don't mind the tangy smell of sewer.

Member_007_5.speaker: Bad Twin Bubbins
Member_007_5.text: Don't bother scoping out the back-tunnels. Whole place is gone dark until all this drama is over with.

AD_Roah_TakeoverCancelled_AllMenDead_0.speaker: Roah Moonglow
AD_Roah_TakeoverCancelled_AllMenDead_0.text: Well. Can't quite seal the deal with all my soldiers dead...
AD_Roah_TakeoverCancelled_AllMenDead_0.context: NodeContext: Returning to GH to find most of her fighters dead - to herself, reflecting that she can't pull the coup she was planning

AD_Ninefingers_Combat_05_0.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
AD_Ninefingers_Combat_05_0.text: You've made your choice, Zhentarim. Now die for it.
AD_Ninefingers_Combat_05_0.context: NodeContext: Battle-cry, but understated in her style.

AD_BossFriol_TakeoverCancelled_MostMenDe.speaker: Boss Friol
AD_BossFriol_TakeoverCancelled_MostMenDe.text: Stlarning shit. What happened to my soldiers? Can't pull this off with this few...
AD_BossFriol_TakeoverCancelled_MostMenDe.context: NodeContext: All her soldiers have been killed before she can pull the ambush on NineFingers she was planning. Quiet frustration, panic.

AD_FetchersBrat_002_SalesPitch_0.speaker: Sticky Dondo
AD_FetchersBrat_002_SalesPitch_0.text: Fine jewellery, lifted fresh from rich fat fingers!
AD_FetchersBrat_002_SalesPitch_0.context: NodeContext: Thieving kid calling out his wares

AD_FetchersBrat_002_SalesPitch_1.speaker: Sticky Dondo
AD_FetchersBrat_002_SalesPitch_1.text: Support your own! Better prices here than topside!
AD_FetchersBrat_002_SalesPitch_1.context: NodeContext: Thieving kid calling out his wares

AD_FetchersBrat_002_SalesPitch_2.speaker: Sticky Dondo
AD_FetchersBrat_002_SalesPitch_2.text: Come on now, guys! Nine-Fingers herself bought a very fine hat from me!
AD_FetchersBrat_002_SalesPitch_2.context: NodeContext: Thieving kid calling out his wares

AD_FetchersBrat_002_SalesPitch_3.speaker: Sticky Dondo
AD_FetchersBrat_002_SalesPitch_3.text: See anything you like, let's talk price! See anything of yours - no, you didn't.
AD_FetchersBrat_002_SalesPitch_3.context: NodeContext: Thieving kid calling out his wares

AD_Zhent_Mercenary_005_AdmiringArt_0.speaker: Lugarrio
AD_Zhent_Mercenary_005_AdmiringArt_0.text: Got a nephew likes paint. Well, eating paint. Might be a trade in this, eh?

Visitor_006_0.speaker: Phostlethwaite
Visitor_006_0.text: |This place stinks, in a good way.|

Member_005_1.speaker: Doozy the Dunce
Member_005_1.text: Hello, stranger. No need to ask what I'm doing down here. It's a personal matter.

Member_005_8.speaker: Doozy the Dunce
Member_005_8.text: Please, not a step closer! I, uh, lost a ring in the mud here and I don't want you to step on it and bury it.

Member_005_3.speaker: Doozy the Dunce
Member_005_3.text: Yes, I'm still looking. This is important.

Member_005_2.speaker: Doozy the Dunce
Member_005_2.text: I offered Lady Ague a ring and she tossed it into the mud. There, I finally told somebody.

Member_005_4.speaker: Player
Member_005_4.text: Would this be the ring you're looking for?

Member_005_5.speaker: Narrator
Member_005_5.text: *Doozy takes the ring, staring in amazement. No words escape his lips.*

Bodyguard_002_1.speaker: Lady Quinsy
Bodyguard_002_1.text: We serve her still, and so do you.
Bodyguard_002_1.context: NodeContext: Repeated like a loyal soldier's mantra

Bodyguard_002_2.speaker: Lady Quinsy
Bodyguard_002_2.text: Knife. A hot one, I think.
Bodyguard_002_2.context: NodeContext: Matter of fact, stating how she'd kill us if she had to (we may have no idea what she's saying)

ThiefHideoutLeader_1.speaker: Mol
ThiefHideoutLeader_1.text: Talk to Sticky. Until I come to collect, our business is done.
ThiefHideoutLeader_1.context: NodeContext: Grim, angry - we told her that we killed her patron and she plans to get us back some day

ThiefHideoutLeader_27.speaker: Mol
ThiefHideoutLeader_27.text: Well, look who it is. Glad to see you in the city - hope you found plenty of coin in Ketheric's coffers.
ThiefHideoutLeader_27.context: NodeContext: A fond greeting - ribbing is as close to affection as she'll get

ThiefHideoutLeader_59.speaker: Mol
ThiefHideoutLeader_59.text: Well, look who it is. Looking to mess up my operation here, too? You'll find it a little harder than before.

ThiefHideoutLeader_60.speaker: Mol
ThiefHideoutLeader_60.text: So I'd suggest you just stick to business, yeah?

ThiefHideoutLeader_65.speaker: Mol
ThiefHideoutLeader_65.text: Welcome on, welcome all. You're looking at Fetcher's Brats, the Guildhall's finest.

ThiefHideoutLeader_41.speaker: Player
ThiefHideoutLeader_41.text: Good to see you again. What are you up to this time?

ThiefHideoutLeader_53.speaker: Mol
ThiefHideoutLeader_53.text: Oh, I've got a few ideas. I'll be running this whole place in no time.

ThiefHideoutLeader_62.speaker: Player
ThiefHideoutLeader_62.text: Somehow, this is just the kind of place I'd expect to find you.

ThiefHideoutLeader_13.speaker: Mol
ThiefHideoutLeader_13.text: You always were sharp, if a bit slow. Too big to be quick. But I'll stay out of your way if you'll stay out of mine.

ThiefHideoutLeader_47.speaker: Player
ThiefHideoutLeader_47.text: Is this a Guild business you're running here?

ThiefHideoutLeader_29.speaker: Mol
ThiefHideoutLeader_29.text: What else? The Guildhall is still standing, even if Nine-Fingers isn't. Just means there's a chair to be filled.

ThiefHideoutLeader_30.speaker: Mol
ThiefHideoutLeader_30.text: Now if you're here for business, talk to Sticky. I don't deal directly with the customers.

ThiefHideoutLeader_57.speaker: Mol
ThiefHideoutLeader_57.text: That's right, specialising in pre-owned goods. You want to trade, talk to Sticky there. I'm in management. Busy, you know?

ThiefHideoutLeader_40.speaker: Mol
ThiefHideoutLeader_40.text: Sure is. We work for Fetcher, handling what you might call pre-owned goods. Talk to Sticky, he'll cut you a deal.

ThiefHideoutLeader_33.speaker: Player
ThiefHideoutLeader_33.text: You're still trading? Aren't you concerned with the new management?

ThiefHideoutLeader_54.speaker: Mol
ThiefHideoutLeader_54.text: Please. The Zhentarim can hold the Guildhall - but that's not the same as holding the Guild itself.

ThiefHideoutLeader_16.speaker: Mol
ThiefHideoutLeader_16.text: Once they realise that, they'll be looking for a... mediator. Someone to speak for the crews. I'll be right here.

ThiefHideoutLeader_39.speaker: Mol
ThiefHideoutLeader_39.text: I survived the hells when Elturel fell. Compared to that, slipping out of Moonrise was child's play.

ThiefHideoutLeader_4.speaker: Player
ThiefHideoutLeader_4.text: I found your eye patch at Moonrise. How did you escape that place?

ThiefHideoutLeader_38.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mol dons the eye patch

ThiefHideoutLeader_63.speaker: Player
ThiefHideoutLeader_63.text: I found the contract you signed with Raphael, Mol. Do you want it?

ThiefHideoutLeader_14.speaker: Mol
ThiefHideoutLeader_14.text: Give me that. Can't have this floating around loose. I thought I was meant to be the thief?
ThiefHideoutLeader_14.context: CinematicNodeContext: Standard 'receive item out of shot' animation

ThiefHideoutLeader_49.speaker: Player
ThiefHideoutLeader_49.text: Is this how you survived the shadowlands? A deal with Raphael?

ThiefHideoutLeader_19.speaker: Mol
ThiefHideoutLeader_19.text: So what if it is? Choosing the right allies is just common sense. Even you'll make a friend or two eventually, I bet.

ThiefHideoutLeader_5.speaker: Mol
ThiefHideoutLeader_5.text: So what if it is? Choosing the right allies is just common sense. You wouldn't have made it this far on your own.

ThiefHideoutLeader_17.speaker: Mol
ThiefHideoutLeader_17.text: Big Raph doesn't own me - he's just giving me the tools to keep myself alive, and to take what I want.

ThiefHideoutLeader_61.speaker: Player
ThiefHideoutLeader_61.text: Are you going to destroy it?

ThiefHideoutLeader_26.speaker: Mol
ThiefHideoutLeader_26.text: Why? Don't know about you, but I don't put my name to something I don't mean.

ThiefHideoutLeader_32.speaker: Mol
ThiefHideoutLeader_32.text: A pact is just another deal. He can call himself 'patron', but Big Raph doesn't own me - he's just giving me the tools to take what I want.

ThiefHideoutLeader_50.speaker: Mol
ThiefHideoutLeader_50.text: As for what that is, well... you didn't think I planned to stop at running the Fetcher's Brats, did you?

ThiefHideoutLeader_11.speaker: Player
ThiefHideoutLeader_11.text: I hope you don't regret this, Mol.

ThiefHideoutLeader_12.speaker: Mol
ThiefHideoutLeader_12.text: Come find me when I'm running this whole Guild, and see how easily the gold wipes away any regrets I do have.

ThiefHideoutLeader_28.speaker: Player
ThiefHideoutLeader_28.text: There'll be no Guild to run if the city falls. Can I count on your help when the fighting begins?

ThiefHideoutLeader_7.speaker: Mol
ThiefHideoutLeader_7.text: I wouldn't miss it for the world. Baldur's Gate is home now, and the Brats are my family. Nobody messes with my family.

ThiefHideoutLeader_31.speaker: Mol
ThiefHideoutLeader_31.text: I'll leave the frontline hero work to the likes of you. We'll be here to pick up the pieces when you're done.

ThiefHideoutLeader_66.speaker: Player
ThiefHideoutLeader_66.text: There's a fight for the city's survival coming. When it does, lend me the power of your pact.

ThiefHideoutLeader_37.speaker: Player
ThiefHideoutLeader_37.text: Raphael's dead, Mol. I killed him.

ThiefHideoutLeader_51.speaker: Mol
ThiefHideoutLeader_51.text: You... bloody idiot. You can kill half the devils in the hells for all I care - but Raphael was my patron. He made promises.

ThiefHideoutLeader_6.speaker: Mol
ThiefHideoutLeader_6.text: This is just a hiccup though. I'll still run this city one day, with or without Raph. And when I do, my Guild won't look on you too kindly.

ThiefHideoutLeader_48.speaker: Player
ThiefHideoutLeader_48.text: I'm impressed. You saw an opportunity for power and you took it.

ThiefHideoutLeader_15.speaker: Mol
ThiefHideoutLeader_15.text: I knew you'd understand. Everyone's owned by somebody - might as well sign up to be on the winning team.

ThiefHideoutLeader_44.speaker: Player
ThiefHideoutLeader_44.text: Make sure we're all on the winning team. There's a fight for the city's survival coming, and I'll need your help.

ThiefHideoutLeader_42.speaker: Player
ThiefHideoutLeader_42.text: This will end badly, Mol. Everyone who takes a devil's deal thinks they'll be in control.

ThiefHideoutLeader_58.speaker: Mol
ThiefHideoutLeader_58.text: You should know by now that I'm not everyone. If Raphael doesn't know that yet - he'll learn.

ThiefHideoutLeader_46.speaker: Player
ThiefHideoutLeader_46.text: Show me what you're capable of. There's a fight for the city's survival coming - can I count on your help?

ThiefHideoutLeader_35.speaker: Player
ThiefHideoutLeader_35.text: Why would you sign a deal with a devil?

ThiefHideoutLeader_56.speaker: Player
ThiefHideoutLeader_56.text: I killed Raphael. In Hell. He's gone for good.

AD_Member_005_LookingForSomething_0.speaker: Doozy the Dunce
AD_Member_005_LookingForSomething_0.text: Did she have to throw my ring into the mud?

AD_Friol_Combat_02_0.speaker: Boss Friol
AD_Friol_Combat_02_0.text: Thieves and swindlers - high time you met soldiers!

Zhent_Mercenary_003_0.speaker: Carlorina the Wolf
Zhent_Mercenary_003_0.text: Nine-Fingers was a thief, and worse - I suppose that makes us the good guys, eh?

Zhent_Mercenary_003_2.speaker: Carlorina the Wolf
Zhent_Mercenary_003_2.text: Don't expect much chat from Fishbait. Boss skewered his tongue on a hook years past.
Zhent_Mercenary_003_2.context: NodeContext: Hushed, as if leaning in and telling us something ominous

Zhent_Mercenary_003_1.speaker: Carlorina the Wolf
Zhent_Mercenary_003_1.text: Only joking! He's just a surly bastard - we call him Fishbait 'cos of the smell.
Zhent_Mercenary_003_1.context: NodeContext: Brightening up from previous line - she was just fucking with us. Serious about the smell, though.

Zhent_Mercenary_003_4.speaker: Carlorina the Wolf
Zhent_Mercenary_003_4.text: I know times are tough, but this crowd could mingle a bit, eh? We're all on the same side.
Zhent_Mercenary_003_4.context: NodeContext: Looking around, a little annoyed that all the Guild members are remaining split off from the Zhent.

Zhent_Mercenary_003_5.speaker: Carlorina the Wolf
Zhent_Mercenary_003_5.text: They might've told us we were going to turn our coats from the start. Wouldn't have bothered trying to make any friends.

AD_Zhent_LeaderBackup_AfterCoup_0.speaker: Trinoda
AD_Zhent_LeaderBackup_AfterCoup_0.text: Settle in, lads - we've found our home away from home!
AD_Zhent_LeaderBackup_AfterCoup_0.context: NodeContext: Calling out to Guild with threat / offer - she'll give the order to have them all killed if they don't hand over NF.

NineFingers_23.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_23.text: Come to derail any other Guild operations? Spit in my eye, perhaps? Or do you just need something?
NineFingers_23.context: NodeContext: Eyes open, friendly, waiting to hear on how we plan to fuck up her operations next

NineFingers_38.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_38.text: It's an orphanage, Uktar. What would you have me do - seize their toys as payment?
NineFingers_38.context: NodeContext: Mid-conversation, but very clearly exasperated with the topic - stating obvious to a subordinate who does not see it

NineFingers_5.speaker: Uktar
NineFingers_5.text: They failed to pay tribute. We should withdraw our protection, at the very least.

NineFingers_81.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_81.text: And cede more ground to the Stone Lord? You're not suggesting I yield a single inch of the city - my city - to this cult?
NineFingers_81.context: NodeContext: Narrowed eyes with an edge in her town

NineFingers_60.speaker: Uktar
NineFingers_60.text: I... We already look weak. If you're seen to be forgiving debts -
NineFingers_60.context: NodeContext: Realizing he's overstepped but trying to make his point nonetheless

NineFingers_293.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_293.text: I didn't say 'forgive'. Seize the building. Arm any children old enough. If they protect what's mine, we'll consider that a start on what's owed.
NineFingers_293.context: NodeContext: Cutting Uktar off. Making it clear she's not soft-hearted - her plan is even more pragmatic than his

NineFingers_50.speaker: Uktar
NineFingers_50.text: ...Yes, guildmaster. I - excuse me? This is a private council.
NineFingers_50.context: CinematicNodeContext: Turning to notice player mid-way through in shock and anger, making to summon guards.NodeContext: Frustrated but has lost the argument - then indignation as he spots us

NineFingers_118.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_118.text: Keep your underpants clean, Uktar. We're playing host to a hero.
NineFingers_118.context: NodeContext: Amused, unfazed, as if she knew we were there

NineFingers_69.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_69.text: You owe me a gold piece, grandmother.
NineFingers_69.context: NodeContext: Idle surprise, as if unconcerned to see Jaheira walk into her hall. 'Grandmother' is faux-respectful, not overly sentimental

NineFingers_313.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_313.text: When I heard you died out in the wilderness, I made an offering at Kelemvor's well.
NineFingers_313.context: NodeContext: Idle surprise, as if unconcerned to see Jaheira walk into her hall.

NineFingers_85.speaker: Jaheira
NineFingers_85.text: Of gold? I did not know I meant so much to you, guildmaster.
NineFingers_85.context: NodeContext: Playing along, dryly amused. Knows Nine-Fingers well enough to know she is flexing, and letting her get on with it.

NineFingers_220.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_220.text: I'm terribly sentimental. Case in point - I've just let a Harper walk through my Guildhall, noticeably unholed.

NineFingers_267.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_267.text: And with a familiar face in tow.
NineFingers_267.context: NodeContext: Tone sharpening just enough to be threatening - 'I let you walk in, but depending what you say, I might not let you walk out again'

NineFingers_285.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_285.text: Because I'm curious. About why you're here - and who it is you've brought with you.
NineFingers_285.context: NodeContext: Tone sharpening just enough to be threatening - 'I let you walk in, but depending what you say, I might not let you walk out again'

NineFingers_58.speaker: Player
NineFingers_58.text: Well, you already know I'm a friend of Jaheira's.

NineFingers_154.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_154.text: How nice. You won't find many of those in my Guildhall.
NineFingers_154.context: NodeContext: Lightly amused by our earnestness

NineFingers_145.speaker: Jaheira
NineFingers_145.text: We won't tax your hospitality too long, Nine-Fingers. I'm searching for Minsc of Rashemen.

NineFingers_246.speaker: Player
NineFingers_246.text: Hi there. I'm a friend of Jaheira's.

NineFingers_216.speaker: Player
NineFingers_216.text: A passer-by. I heard you serve good food down here.

NineFingers_314.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_314.text: Hah! The best in the city, under or above. So smart a mouth as yours would enjoy it, provided you keep all your teeth.
NineFingers_314.context: NodeContext: Genuine bark of a laugh - she appreciates audacity, but is also warning not to go too far

NineFingers_175.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_175.text: Thinking about moving in? I have some lovely lightless cells I could show you.
NineFingers_175.context: NodeContext: Genuine amusement at our audacity, but with an edge.

NineFingers_188.speaker: Jaheira
NineFingers_188.text: This is the one who saved my life. So really, they owe you your gold piece.

NineFingers_90.speaker: Jaheira
NineFingers_90.text: But we can settle debts later, Nine-Fingers. For now, we need help - we're searching for Minsc of Rashemen.

NineFingers_174.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_174.text: A big name, that. Such information does not come cheap, High Harper. Not in normal times.
NineFingers_174.context: NodeContext: A beat of consideration - we've strayed onto a dangerous topic, and it should be clear

NineFingers_55.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_55.text: Of course... seeing as these are not normal times, and we're all such good friends... I'll do better than tell you where he is. I'm bringing him here as we speak.
NineFingers_55.context: NodeContext: Still considering, dangerous. Pitching what's happening as a good thing, but knows we won't see it as such

NineFingers_140.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_140.text: Or - parts of him, at least. I gave no orders about the condition of his corpse.
NineFingers_140.context: NodeContext: Idle, no fanfare to dropping this bombshell - she's telling us she's ordered Minsc's death and won't let us see her sweat over it.

NineFingers_125.speaker: Jaheira
NineFingers_125.text: What treachery is this, Nine-Fingers? Have you thrown in with the Absolute, too?
NineFingers_125.context: CinematicNodeContext: Can't have her draw weapon, but aggressive stance - with Nine-Fingers' guards responding in kind. Heightened tension.NodeContext: Wary, masking the real danger of the situation. Asked idly, but is ready for to fight her way out of an ambush if that's what this is.

NineFingers_337.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_337.text: Against my own city? Careful - you're in very real danger of hurting my feelings.
NineFingers_337.context: NodeContext: Still mild, but an edge coming through - we do NOT want to offend her

NineFingers_37.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_37.text: It's Minsc who's found his faith with Faerûn's newest god. And a new name with it - the Stone Lord.
NineFingers_37.context: NodeContext: Emphasis on Stone Lord is faux-spookiness, not actual emotion

NineFingers_173.speaker: Jaheira
NineFingers_173.context: NodeContext: Quiet hiss - trying to be dismissive, but real anger showing through.

NineFingers_182.speaker: Player
NineFingers_182.text: You say that name as if it means something.

NineFingers_167.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_167.text: It should. My people speak it in the same breath as Sarevok and Demogorgon, but he's just another upstart.

NineFingers_101.speaker: Player
NineFingers_101.text: The Stone Lord? The new gang boss your people are so afraid of?

NineFingers_152.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_152.text: Exactly the one. Guild crews may be prone to exaggeration, but... not in this case.

NineFingers_209.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_209.text: In his short reign, the Stone Lord and his crew have earned a reputation. Pure brutality. No survivors. And where he mows my people down, this ripe little cult takes root.
NineFingers_209.context: NodeContext: Controlled anger - she does not like being put on the back foot

NineFingers_277.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_277.text: But not for much longer. We have word on where he plans to hit next - and he'll find us ready to hit back this time.
NineFingers_277.context: NodeContext: Getting the anger under control - she has it all in hand.

NineFingers_80.speaker: Jaheira
NineFingers_80.text: Nine-Fingers - Astele. Call off your ambush. Tell us where he is, and we'll handle this.
NineFingers_80.context: NodeContext: Urgent - dropping the games and appealing directly to Nine-Fingers with the first name not many know.

NineFingers_131.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_131.text: 'We'? I heard what happened to your Harpers, Jaheira. I'm sorry - but this fight's too big for you alone.
NineFingers_131.context: NodeContext: A very slight softening - not pity, or even mercy, but understanding. She respects Jaheira even as an opponent, but doesn't like seeing her helpless. Trying to drive the knife home gently.

NineFingers_108.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_108.text: 'We'? I see no Harpers, Jaheira. I'm sorry - but this fight's too big for you alone.
NineFingers_108.context: NodeContext: A very slight softening - not pity, or even mercy, but understanding. She respects Jaheira even as an opponent, but doesn't like seeing her helpless. Trying to drive the knife home gently.

NineFingers_84.speaker: Player
NineFingers_84.text: She's not alone - she has me.

NineFingers_73.speaker: Player
NineFingers_73.text: You really think that will stop her?

NineFingers_114.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_114.text: If you're half the friend you're posing as, you'll tell her that her part in this is done.
NineFingers_114.context: NodeContext: Serious, no act - this is the best thing we could do for Jaheira.

NineFingers_46.speaker: Player
NineFingers_46.text: We can handle this. Trust us.

NineFingers_43.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_43.text: I don't let trust tie my hands. That's why I sit in this very fine office.
NineFingers_43.context: NodeContext: Unmoved by our pleas - she's ruthless, and unapologetic about it

NineFingers_298.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_298.text: The Stone Lord's fate is sealed. We have a bigger war to fight. I'd rather turn our talk to that, but if you need a moment, Jaheira...
NineFingers_298.context: NodeContext: Her mind isn't going to be changed and she's moving on. But her urging for us to keep it is genuinely sincere - she respects Jaheira, and doesn't want this to get ugly.

NineFingers_54.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_54.text: Well, you've earned that much. My Guildhall is open to you. Have a drink, Jaheira. Have a rest.
NineFingers_54.context: NodeContext: Shrugging - she's going to kill our friend, but it's not like she expects us to be happy about it.

NineFingers_176.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_176.text: Just leave well enough alone. It would be a shame for the city to lose two of its heroes in one day.
NineFingers_176.context: NodeContext: A parting warning - she knows Jaheira is almost inevitably going to interfere and is making herself clear. 'Don't make me kill you.'

NineFingers_86.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_86.text: Out of respect for the High Harper, I'm going to pretend you're just scratching your arse.
NineFingers_86.context: CinematicNodeContext: Casual, not even looking at us.NodeContext: Casual, not even looking at us.

NineFingers_302.speaker: Player
NineFingers_302.text: What makes you think he's joined the Absolute? Maybe he just doesn't like thieves.

NineFingers_190.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_190.text: Aye, I considered that. But there's a pattern to his strikes - an intent.

NineFingers_306.speaker: Player
NineFingers_306.text: It makes sense, Jaheira. We know the cult can be... persuasive.

NineFingers_268.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_268.text: Minsc was never one to need much persuading. Not when it came to spilling my people's blood.

NineFingers_310.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_310.text: You owe me a gold piece, grandmother.
NineFingers_310.context: NodeContext: Idle surprise, as if unconcerned to see Jaheira walk into her hall. 'Grandmother' is faux-respectful, not overly sentimental

NineFingers_103.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_103.text: When I heard you died out in the wilderness, I made an offering at Kelemvor's well.
NineFingers_103.context: NodeContext: Idle surprise, as if unconcerned to see Jaheira walk into her hall.

NineFingers_231.speaker: Jaheira
NineFingers_231.text: Of gold? I did not know I meant so much to you, guildmaster.

NineFingers_297.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_297.text: I'm terribly sentimental. Case in point - I've just let a Harper walk through my Guildhall, noticeably unholed.

NineFingers_340.speaker: Jaheira
NineFingers_340.text: I won't tax your hospitality too long, Nine-Fingers. I'm searching for Minsc of Rashemen.

NineFingers_237.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_237.text: A big name, that. Such information does not come cheap, High Harper. Not in normal times.
NineFingers_237.context: NodeContext: A beat of consideration - we've strayed onto a dangerous topic, and it should be clear

NineFingers_123.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_123.text: Of course... seeing as these are not normal times, and we're all such good friends... I'll do better than tell you where he is. I'm bringing him here as we speak.
NineFingers_123.context: NodeContext: Still considering, dangerous. Pitching what's happening as a good thing, but knows we won't see it as such

NineFingers_49.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_49.text: Or - parts of him, at least. I gave no orders about the condition of his corpse.
NineFingers_49.context: NodeContext: Idle, no fanfare to dropping this bombshell - she's telling us she's ordered Minsc's death and won't let us see her sweat over it.

NineFingers_149.speaker: Jaheira
NineFingers_149.text: What treachery is this, Nine-Fingers? Have you thrown in with the Absolute, too?
NineFingers_149.context: CinematicNodeContext: Can't have her draw weapon, but aggressive stance - with Nine-Fingers' guards responding in kind. Heightened tension.NodeContext: Wary, masking the real danger of the situation. Asked idly, but is ready for to fight her way out of an ambush if that's what this is.

NineFingers_79.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_79.text: Against my own city? Careful - you're in very real danger of hurting my feelings.
NineFingers_79.context: NodeContext: Still mild, but an edge coming through - we do NOT want to offend her

NineFingers_203.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_203.text: It's Minsc who's found his faith with Faerûn's newest god. And a new name with it - the Stone Lord.
NineFingers_203.context: NodeContext: Emphasis on Stone Lord is faux-spookiness, not actual emotion

NineFingers_64.speaker: Jaheira
NineFingers_64.context: NodeContext: Quiet hiss - trying to be dismissive, but real anger showing through.

NineFingers_271.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_271.text: In his short reign, the Stone Lord and his crew have earned a reputation. Pure brutality. No survivors. And where he mows my people down, this ripe little cult takes root.
NineFingers_271.context: NodeContext: Controlled anger - she does not like being put on the back foot

NineFingers_68.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_68.text: But not for much longer. We have word on where he plans to hit next - and he'll find us ready to hit back this time.
NineFingers_68.context: NodeContext: Getting the anger under control - she has it all in hand.

NineFingers_215.speaker: Jaheira
NineFingers_215.text: Nine-Fingers - Astele. Call off your ambush. Tell us where he is, and we'll handle this.
NineFingers_215.context: NodeContext: Urgent - dropping the games and appealing directly to Nine-Fingers with the first name not many know.

NineFingers_172.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_172.text: 'We'? I heard what happened to your Harpers, Jaheira. I'm sorry - but this fight's too big for you alone.
NineFingers_172.context: NodeContext: A very slight softening - not pity, or even mercy, but understanding. She respects Jaheira even as an opponent, but doesn't like seeing her helpless. Trying to drive the knife home gently.

NineFingers_115.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_115.text: 'We'? I see no Harpers, Jaheira. I'm sorry - but this fight's too big for you alone.
NineFingers_115.context: NodeContext: A very slight softening - not pity, or even mercy, but understanding. She respects Jaheira even as an opponent, but doesn't like seeing her helpless. Trying to drive the knife home gently.

NineFingers_319.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_319.text: The Stone Lord's fate is sealed. We have a bigger war to fight. I'd rather turn our talk to that, but if you need a moment, Jaheira...
NineFingers_319.context: NodeContext: Her mind isn't going to be changed and she's moving on. But her urging for us to keep it is genuinely sincere - she respects Jaheira, and doesn't want this to get ugly.

NineFingers_65.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_65.text: Just leave well enough alone. It would be a shame for the city to lose two of its heroes in one day.
NineFingers_65.context: NodeContext: A parting warning - she knows Jaheira is almost inevitably going to interfere and is making herself clear. 'Don't make me kill you.'

NineFingers_74.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_74.text: You recall our reports of Ketheric Thorm? General of the Absolute, champion of Myrkul, unkillable-tyrant-of-Moonrise?
NineFingers_74.context: CinematicNodeContext: Unfazed, turning to look at player as if we were expected. Appraises us while still addressing Uktar.NodeContext: Appraising us, listing Ketheric's titles as if bored with them

NineFingers_39.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_39.text: Meet the one who killed him.
NineFingers_39.context: CinematicNodeContext: With a casual 'ta-da' gesture.NodeContext: A modicum more respect in this simple introduction than for all Ketheric's titles

NineFingers_236.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_236.text: Was it the Harper who tipped you off, or something else?
NineFingers_236.context: CinematicNodeContext: Deadpan, holding up her hand to display the missing finger.NodeContext: Deadpan, amused

NineFingers_78.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_78.text: A little less impressive, as revelations go.
NineFingers_78.context: CinematicNodeContext: Deadpan, holding up her hand to display the missing finger.NodeContext: Deadpan, amused

NineFingers_110.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_110.text: You'll forgive the spying, I hope. The Guild keeps watch for anyone of interest passing through our gates.

NineFingers_192.speaker: Player
NineFingers_192.text: I don't want to talk about me. I want to talk about Minsc.

NineFingers_292.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_292.text: And when we're sitting in your stronghold, I'll give a good slippery shite about what you want.
NineFingers_292.context: NodeContext: Sharp, letting her anger show - not freaking out, just putting us in our place before returning to her normal tone.

NineFingers_224.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_224.text: You're with the Harper, so you already know there's a war coming. And I already know the only thing about you that I need to.
NineFingers_224.context: NodeContext: Laying out the reason we're natural allies.

NineFingers_275.speaker: Player
NineFingers_275.text: Am I interrupting? Your guards just let me pass.

NineFingers_62.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_62.text: Of course. They knew you were expected.

NineFingers_299.speaker: Player
NineFingers_299.text: How do you know who I am?

NineFingers_249.speaker: Player
NineFingers_249.text: My fame precedes me. That, or you've been spying on me.

NineFingers_10.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_10.text: Whichever one gives you the most comfort.

NineFingers_208.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_208.text: The Guild is this city's first and last line of defence. It's only natural that we watch the gates for anyone interesting.

NineFingers_191.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_191.text: I'd say you qualify. I already know the only thing about you that I need to.
NineFingers_191.context: NodeContext: Not overly complimentary - just stating facts

NineFingers_92.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_92.text: You've crossed paths with the cult's leadership before, and you're still standing.
NineFingers_92.context: NodeContext: Not overly complimentary - just stating facts. 'Not bad'.

NineFingers_210.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_210.text: I mean to burn the Absolute from the face of my city. So if you mean to help, congratulations - we just became the best of friends.
NineFingers_210.context: NodeContext: Challenge in her tone. She loves her city, and hates those who presume to push in on her power even more.

NineFingers_260.speaker: Player
NineFingers_260.text: You seem to know quite a bit about the cult.

NineFingers_290.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_290.text: As, it seems, do you. I already know the only thing about you that I need to.
NineFingers_290.context: NodeContext: Not overly complimentary - just stating facts

NineFingers_41.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_41.text: Ah. You're the one working with the Harper.
NineFingers_41.context: NodeContext: Casual, is unfazed if we appear after her confrontation with Jaheira and know who she is.

NineFingers_48.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_48.text: I knew Jaheira was back in the city - alive and kicking and with a new friend in tow. Your exploits together are causing quite a stir.
NineFingers_48.context: NodeContext: Friendly greeting, but slowly letting her anger seep through - in this case, we're meeting her for the first time, but she knows we foiled her ambush against Minsc

NineFingers_1.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_1.text: I thought you'd come to Baldur's Gate to finish the job you started at Moonrise.
NineFingers_1.context: NodeContext: Faux puzzlement: ' please explain the dumb thing you did, because I'm sure there's some secret genius to it'

NineFingers_280.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_280.text: So tell me - why would you kill Ketheric and chase his co-conspirators to the city, only to turn on us at the last moment? Why let Minsc get away?
NineFingers_280.context: NodeContext: Faux puzzlement: ' please explain the dumb thing you did, because I'm sure there's some secret genius to it'

NineFingers_323.speaker: Player
NineFingers_323.text: I didn't turn on anyone - but Minsc is not the enemy.

NineFingers_272.speaker: Player
NineFingers_272.text: I'm here to stop the Absolute. I won't be questioned by you.

NineFingers_2.speaker: Player
NineFingers_2.text: Wait - how do you know who I am?

NineFingers_105.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_105.text: It's my business. And not what should concern you most right now.

NineFingers_99.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_99.text: The Stone Lord - Minsc - is the Absolute's enforcer-in-chief. Every piece of territory he takes from me goes to the cult.

NineFingers_134.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_134.text: You are apparently the city's best chance of sending the Absolute packing. So yes - I need you alive.

NineFingers_82.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_82.text: We meet at last. Your exploits are causing quite a stir.
NineFingers_82.context: NodeContext: Friendly greeting, but slowly letting her anger seep through - in this case, we're meeting her for the first time, but she knows we foiled her ambush against Minsc

NineFingers_111.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_111.text: You have a cult to kill. What do you need from me to do it?

NineFingers_226.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_226.text: You keep good company. But don't think you can hide from me in the Harper's shadow.

NineFingers_44.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_44.text: I hear things, in my work. Like the rise of General Ketheric Thorm, Chosen of Myrkul, unkillable-tyrant-of-Moonrise.

NineFingers_281.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_281.text: And I hear you're the one who killed him.

NineFingers_126.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_126.text: I knew you'd try and stick your beak in, Harper. You can't help yourself.
NineFingers_126.context: NodeContext: The very first time she's seeing Jaheira - in this flow, we went and fucked up Nine-Fingers' trap before even speaking to her. She's pissed off and keeping it contained, but not afraid to let us know we're in danger.

NineFingers_212.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_212.text: You had a grand plan to save Minsc from big bad Nine-Fingers. So why did you let him escape?
NineFingers_212.context: NodeContext: Sarcastic - surely Jaheira had a good reason for messing up her trap

NineFingers_136.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_136.text: We haven't known each other for very long, so perhaps I ought to clarify.
NineFingers_136.context: NodeContext: Casual, but boiling with fury underneath

NineFingers_91.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_91.text: When I say 'Don't interfere, or else' - most people avoid finding out what 'or else' means.

NineFingers_139.speaker: Player
NineFingers_139.text: I suppose I was just curious.

NineFingers_157.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_157.text: Curious by nature, are you? Ever wondered what it's like to have your skin peeled off?
NineFingers_157.context: NodeContext: Not letting our joke get under her skin, restating her threat

NineFingers_207.speaker: Player
NineFingers_207.text: I told you Jaheira and I would handle it. Just let us.

NineFingers_184.speaker: Player
NineFingers_184.text: I told you we would handle it. Let us.

NineFingers_250.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_250.text: Rather than stuffing you in a box and dropping you into the river, you mean?
NineFingers_250.context: NodeContext: Casual, but boiling with fury underneath

NineFingers_225.speaker: Player
NineFingers_225.text: Your ambush was a complete failure - and it would've been worse if we hadn't been there.

NineFingers_153.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_153.text: You think so? Perhaps I'll buy a better mimic - test it on you, hm?
NineFingers_153.context: NodeContext: Casual, but boiling with fury underneath

NineFingers_156.speaker: Jaheira
NineFingers_156.text: No threats, Astele. We are your allies, whether you want to see it or not.

NineFingers_96.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_96.text: You're still the city's best chance of sending the Absolute packing. So, yes - I need you. I even like you.
NineFingers_96.context: NodeContext: Sighing, bringing temper under control, pragamatic. Should still be furious and not hiding that from us, but getting on with it

NineFingers_61.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_61.text: But know that I do not need or like anyone so much that I will let them cross me twice.
NineFingers_61.context: NodeContext: This is our final warning

NineFingers_11.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_11.text: You want to handle Minsc? Then handle him - before I do.
NineFingers_11.context: NodeContext: This is our final warning

NineFingers_151.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_151.text: Keep the Harper out of trouble. Just because I don't want to kill her doesn't mean I won't.
NineFingers_151.context: NodeContext: Deadly serious about her threat, and trying to make us believe it so she doesn't actually have to follow through

NineFingers_94.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_94.text: Beyond that - be welcome, be merry. Is there something you require of a humble guildmaster?

NineFingers_205.speaker: Player
NineFingers_205.text: That story you told Minsc - was any of it true?

NineFingers_89.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_89.text: You can't just swallow every bit of story-book tripe that you hear. Do I strike you as a lost little girl looking for a hero?
NineFingers_89.context: NodeContext: Scoffing - in a standoff with Minsc, she told him how he was a hero of hers growing up. Dismissing it now.

NineFingers_166.speaker: Narrator
NineFingers_166.text: *Nine-Fingers Keene, feared guildmaster, is a woman of many masks. And yet with Minsc, you suspect you saw a little truth slip through.*

NineFingers_13.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_13.text: Now lose the stupid look on your face, and tell me what you need.
NineFingers_13.context: NodeContext: Blunt, changing the topic from her story about being a child sheltering beneath Minsc's statue

NineFingers_34.speaker: Player
NineFingers_34.text: Minsc went from an enemy to an asset. You're welcome.

NineFingers_8.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_8.text: Enemies and assets are all the Guild know. Don't think I won't use him.
NineFingers_8.context: NodeContext: Correcting our assumption that she won't be happy to use Minsc if he can help her

NineFingers_165.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_165.text: If the Rashemaar wants to work off a blood-debt, I won't turn him down. He scares my kingpins shitless.
NineFingers_165.context: NodeContext: Correcting our assumption that she won't be happy to use Minsc if he can help her

NineFingers_138.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_138.text: My Guild was too fractured to stand up to the Absolute - too corrupt to see the threat within. I reckon a little bit of hamster-talk might be good for them.
NineFingers_138.context: NodeContext: Correcting our assumption that she won't be happy to use Minsc if he can help her

NineFingers_238.speaker: Jaheira
NineFingers_238.text: And you're sure you'll handle Minsc so easily as that?
NineFingers_238.context: NodeContext: Wry, mock sincerity - Jaheira knows how hard Minsc is to guide sometimes

NineFingers_255.speaker: Minsc
NineFingers_255.text: What? I was trying to spy a nice warm spot for Boo's bedding.
NineFingers_255.context: NodeContext: Abrupt, absolutely was not listening to Jaheira and Nine-Fingers discuss him.

NineFingers_14.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_14.context: NodeContext: Sarcastic - she thinks she can handle Minsc easily

NineFingers_112.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_112.text: We need to survive the fight to come, first. So let's save our talk for a bright new day, hm?

NineFingers_187.speaker: Player
NineFingers_187.text: What can I do to help you?

NineFingers_332.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_332.text: Kill the Absolute, and keep the big bald berserker out of trouble. We'll find out if either of those things is possible.
NineFingers_332.context: NodeContext: Wry - that one task is plenty

NineFingers_168.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_168.context: NodeContext: Keeping a lid on her fury - we botched an operation of hers (or at the very least, were present for its botching - she sees little difference)

NineFingers_309.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_309.text: Do any more, and the Guild might have to take a special interest in you. Understood? Great.
NineFingers_309.context: NodeContext: Tightly controlled anger - a threat to let us know the matter is closed

NineFingers_214.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_214.text: I've already told you. The Stone Lord's planning to walk into my Counting House. Make sure he doesn't walk out again.
NineFingers_214.context: NodeContext: Reminding us what she asked us to do

NineFingers_33.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_33.text: Keep me from having to kill the Harper. Which means keeping out of the Guild's way - all right? Wonderful!
NineFingers_33.context: NodeContext: Reminding us of what she asked. Faux cheerfulness at the end to let us know the matter is settled

NineFingers_318.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_318.text: I need to see Jaheira. Just so happens, she'll want to see me too.
NineFingers_318.context: NodeContext: Reminding us of what she asked

NineFingers_148.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_148.text: I was planning to soften you up a bit first, but - straight to business, then.
NineFingers_148.context: NodeContext: 'Straight to business that easily? Fair enough then'

NineFingers_143.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_143.text: Of all the pains in my arse the Absolute has delivered, one in particular keeps growing. A new gang boss who calls himself the Stone Lord.

NineFingers_274.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_274.text: If he was just another upstart who didn't like paying Guild dues, fair enough. But he and his crew make no demands, leave no survivors to pass on a message.
NineFingers_274.context: NodeContext: Relaying the threat the Stone Lord poses

NineFingers_266.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
