NineFingers_266.text: All I know is that on every scrap of ground he takes from me, the cult of the Absolute soon starts sprouting.

NineFingers_135.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_135.text: He's a prick, whoever he prays to.
NineFingers_135.context: NodeContext: Uncaring of who the Stone Lord serves

NineFingers_200.speaker: Player
NineFingers_200.text: And you want this to become my problem.

NineFingers_122.speaker: Player
NineFingers_122.text: I think you've mistaken me for one of your paid enforcers.

NineFingers_121.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_121.text: I never actually said anything about paying you. Though if it's coin you're after, well - you'll like this next part.

NineFingers_336.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_336.text: We know where he plans to hit next - a little operation the Guild have running in the city's Counting House.

NineFingers_199.speaker: Player
NineFingers_199.text: I encountered a crew of his fighting your people down by the seafront.

NineFingers_324.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_324.text: Aye. Transport corridors. Not the most glamorous targets, but without the vine, the cherries shrivel and die.

NineFingers_305.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_305.text: We know he plans on something higher profile next - a little operation the Guild has running in the Counting House.

NineFingers_189.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_189.text: Likely my crew has it in hand - snare set, ready to draw it tight. But I like a little certainty - and you've dealt with bigger bastards, handily enough.

NineFingers_31.speaker: Player
NineFingers_31.text: Hold on. The Guild has an operation inside the city's bank?

NineFingers_130.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_130.text: Might be more accurate to say the Guild is the city's bank. We bought them out years back - perfectly legitimate. As I said, I like a little certainty.

NineFingers_218.speaker: Player
NineFingers_218.text: I'll head over and check it out.

NineFingers_242.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_242.text: Obliged. Shouldn't pose any problem for you.

NineFingers_341.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_341.text: In return - if I can offer aid, information, just ask.

NineFingers_338.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_338.text: As you like. I always do. My welcome stands - maybe I'm just nicer than you are.

NineFingers_235.speaker: Player
NineFingers_235.text: I hear you. But I wanted to discuss something else.

NineFingers_51.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_51.text: You've been seen with a certain Harper. Grey of hair, somewhat spiky of manner?
NineFingers_51.context: NodeContext: Describing someone she knows we know

NineFingers_253.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_253.text: We're practically sisters! So much so, I even stopped trying to have her killed a few years back.

NineFingers_303.speaker: Player
NineFingers_303.text: 'Somewhat spiky'? In the same way a morningstar is, yes.

NineFingers_47.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_47.context: NodeContext: Wry - we've described Jaheira's temper well

NineFingers_321.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_321.text: I need to speak with her. She's still getting the lay of the land, I expect - I have information that might help with that.

NineFingers_193.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_193.text: So remind her to pay an old friend a visit, would you?

NineFingers_129.speaker: Player
NineFingers_129.text: Can't you just tell me, and I'll pass word along?

NineFingers_300.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_300.text: I could, but she wouldn't thank either of us for that. Trust me.

NineFingers_142.speaker: Player
NineFingers_142.text: She tells me next to nothing either. I see why you two get along.

NineFingers_9.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_9.text: Oh, I never said that we get along.

NineFingers_328.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_328.text: Now - is there anything else you need?

NineFingers_325.speaker: Player
NineFingers_325.text: I need some information from you first.

NineFingers_204.speaker: Player
NineFingers_204.text: I can do that. I'll bring her back here.

NineFingers_202.speaker: Player
NineFingers_202.text: You better not let 'a certain Harper' hear that description.

NineFingers_282.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_282.text: Unless she's taken to dyeing her hair, I'd call it accurate enough.

NineFingers_45.speaker: Player
NineFingers_45.text: That doesn't sound like anyone I know. Sorry.

NineFingers_239.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_239.text: Hm. One of the things I like about Jaheira - for all her Harper wiles, she's not much of a liar. You're a little better.
NineFingers_239.context: NodeContext: Considering. She sees through our bullshit and is letting us know

NineFingers_229.speaker: Player
NineFingers_229.text: Just tell me what you want with her.

NineFingers_133.speaker: Player
NineFingers_133.text: Why do I need the Guild? I've been doing well enough without you so far.

NineFingers_276.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_276.text: You have, but don't be so quick to bat away a helping hand. You'll find few enough of them in this city.
NineFingers_276.context: NodeContext: Amused at our self-belief - not dismissing it, but knows no one can fight the Absolute alone

NineFingers_87.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_87.text: The Flaming Fist can be bought, the Harpers are scattered, and the Parliament of Peers... well, they're just generally too inbred to be useful.
NineFingers_87.context: NodeContext: Listing all the various flawed insitutions she dismisses

NineFingers_102.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_102.text: The Absolute's at our gate, and the Guild are the only ones truly standing against it.

NineFingers_294.speaker: Player
NineFingers_294.text: You can help a companion of mine who needs information - Jaheira.

NineFingers_109.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_109.text: I wasn't surprised to learn you two had fallen in together. I could make a guess at what she needs from me, too.

NineFingers_304.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_304.text: Bring her here. Whatever questions she has, she'll want to hear the answers directly from me.

NineFingers_198.speaker: Player
NineFingers_198.text: We're not done discussing Minsc. Call off your ambush.

NineFingers_147.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_147.text: No begging? Not even a snotty little 'please'? It's almost like you don't know who you're talking to.
NineFingers_147.context: NodeContext: Arched eyebrow - tone is unfazed, but we're beginning to piss her off. Hint of quiet threat in 'you don't know who you're talking to'

NineFingers_132.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_132.text: The order's been given. It's done. So I hope you know another tune, because I'm getting bored of this one.
NineFingers_132.context: NodeContext: Arched eyebrow - tone is unfazed, but we're beginning to piss her off. This topic is off=limits to her

NineFingers_155.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_155.text: Knowing what I know usually comes at a cost. But let's say we'll put it on your tab.

NineFingers_257.speaker: Player
NineFingers_257.text: How is it you know so much about the cult of the Absolute and its leaders?

NineFingers_16.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_16.text: Simple enough. After Jaheira warned me - and then disappeared - I went nosing into the cult for myself.
NineFingers_16.context: NodeContext: Shrugging - espionage is no big deal to her, she hears everything eventually - whether through informants or donning disguises and infiltrating the enemy herself

NineFingers_144.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_144.text: I could bore you with the details. How I found evidence of Gortash's projects, traced him to Orin the Red, and made a safe bet there was some dried out old necromancer to round out the three.
NineFingers_144.context: NodeContext: Shrugging - espionage is no big deal to her, she hears everything eventually - whether through informants or donning disguises and infiltrating the enemy herself

NineFingers_288.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_288.text: Because it's always the Dead bloody Three - has-been half-gods who can't help but make their irrelevance everyone else's problem.
NineFingers_288.context: NodeContext: Quiet eye-rolling at the dead three - they're three particular gods who always target her city, and always end up being foiled.

NineFingers_42.speaker: Player
NineFingers_42.text: There's more to it than just the Dead Three.

NineFingers_296.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_296.text: Oh? You've got some juicy little tidbit I haven't heard yet?
NineFingers_296.context: NodeContext: Actual interest - rare enough for her to hear something she doesn't already know

NineFingers_40.speaker: Player
NineFingers_40.text: Tell her everything. The enslaved elder brain, the Astral Prism - you.

NineFingers_18.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_18.context: NodeContext: Grunt of mute surprise. An anticlimactic response to the world-shattering secret we just told her about about the Absolute being a Dead Three / illithid conspiracy

NineFingers_245.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_245.context: NodeContext: Slightly more inflected grunt of mute surprise.

NineFingers_160.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_160.text: It seems like my intelligence on you was patchy, at best. That's annoying.
NineFingers_160.context: NodeContext: Reconsidering us - less annoyed at the world-ending threat we just told her about, more annoyed that she didn't already know about it

NineFingers_221.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_221.text: Don't pout. For a brief second, I did weigh the odds on killing you.
NineFingers_221.context: NodeContext: Amused at our irritiation at how calmly she took the news that we're infected

NineFingers_256.speaker: Player
NineFingers_256.text: So what do you plan to do, now that you know?

NineFingers_4.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_4.text: I had no intention of leaving my city in the Dead Three's hands. I'm definitely not leaving it to some slimy shit that doesn't even have hands.
NineFingers_4.context: NodeContext: Shrugging, pragmatic - our big secret doesn't change the war she has to fight

NineFingers_100.speaker: Player
NineFingers_100.text: Don't overreact. I'm in control of myself, I swear it.

NineFingers_161.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_161.context: NodeContext: Shrugging, unfazed - her calmness isn't an assumption we can't or won't turn against her, just a grim acceptance that if it happens she'll deal with it

NineFingers_286.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_286.text: But if there's a tainted elder brain slopping around below my city, I think we need one another more than ever.

NineFingers_169.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_169.text: So long as you can keep a lid on what's growing inside you, we're allies. Until you can't, and we're not.
NineFingers_169.context: NodeContext: Shrugging, pragmatic - our big secret doesn't change the war she has to fight

NineFingers_317.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_317.text: Simple enough, I reckon. Now - war to be fought. You need anything?
NineFingers_317.context: NodeContext: Shrugging, pragmatic - our big secret doesn't change the war she has to fight

NineFingers_240.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_240.text: Right. Well. War to be fought - do you need anything else?

NineFingers_312.speaker: Player
NineFingers_312.text: Who is this Stone Lord that has your Guild running scared?

NineFingers_254.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_254.text: The leader of some new crew that's intent on paining my arse.

NineFingers_233.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_233.text: Doesn't matter. Whatever god the prick prays to, I'll send him to meet it soon enough.

NineFingers_331.speaker: Player
NineFingers_331.text: How's your fight against the Absolute going?

NineFingers_329.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_329.text: Hah. Which part? The Stone Lord's hollowed this place out - half my crews are fled or in hiding.
NineFingers_329.context: NodeContext: Grim amusement - we've asked for an update on a terrible situation

NineFingers_29.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_29.text: Orin's Faceless try to pierce my ranks every day, while Gortash's toy soldiers control the streets.
NineFingers_29.context: NodeContext: Grim amusement - we've asked for an update on a terrible situation

NineFingers_227.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_227.text: When the Absolute's army arrives to wage war on the city, our best hope is to make sure they have no leaders in here willing to open the gates for them.
NineFingers_227.context: NodeContext: Just plainly stating the job we have to do

NineFingers_333.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_333.text: You've dealt with Orin, but Gortash still clutters my streets with his toy soldiers.
NineFingers_333.context: NodeContext: Grim amusement - we've asked for an update on a terrible situation

NineFingers_258.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_258.text: You might have removed Gortash, but Orin's Faceless are still circling.
NineFingers_258.context: NodeContext: Grim amusement - we've asked for an update on a terrible situation

NineFingers_71.speaker: Player
NineFingers_71.text: You and Jaheira are an odd pairing. How do you know one another?

NineFingers_244.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_244.text: We've crossed paths over the years. Two hands trying to steer the city - just not always in the same direction.
NineFingers_244.context: NodeContext: Speaking of Jaheira, for whom she has equal parts admiration as a fellow protector of the city (as she sees it), and irritation for being a do-gooder who gets in her way

NineFingers_164.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_164.text: I can't stand Harpers, as a rule, but Jaheira's the exception. She's only really half a Harper at most.

NineFingers_28.speaker: Jaheira
NineFingers_28.text: You mean that as a compliment, I am sure.

NineFingers_243.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_243.text: The same way I'm not just the lowly thief, vagabond, and murderer the Watch and Peers would paint me as. I happen to be a fine singer, too.
NineFingers_243.context: NodeContext: Listing off all the aspects of her terrible reputation, humourously making the point that there's more to her than that.

NineFingers_128.speaker: Player
NineFingers_128.text: I noticed the mercenaries in your hall. Since when does the Guild work with the Zhentarim?

NineFingers_36.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_36.text: We don't. The Zhentarim work for me. Time was I'd charge the bastards double if I let them into my hall at all, but times change.
NineFingers_36.context: NodeContext: Distaste - we've broached a topic she's not pleased to talk about, but will

NineFingers_247.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_247.text: The Guild is many things, but it's not an army. If the Absolute keeps pushing in on our territory, then I need a little weight to push back.
NineFingers_247.context: NodeContext: Distaste - we've broached a topic she's not pleased to talk about, but will

NineFingers_334.speaker: Player
NineFingers_334.text: I'd like to know more about the Guild.

NineFingers_116.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_116.text: Thieves, frauds, and miscreants - if it's just the Watch warrants you're reading.
NineFingers_116.context: NodeContext: Eyes wide, faux-alarm as she recites all the tropes about her criminal guild

NineFingers_93.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_93.text: The Guild isn't any one thing. We're everything - all the parts of the city the Watch don't want seen, so they push us to the far side of their law.
NineFingers_93.context: NodeContext: Quiet, defiant pride - the image she paints of the Guild is one that the city's upper crust would scoff at, but one she fervently believes in

NineFingers_269.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_269.text: But it's not that Watch that keeps the peace, or gives justice to any Baldurian who asks, whether they can pay for it or not. It's us.
NineFingers_269.context: NodeContext: Quiet, defiant pride - the image she paints of the Guild is one that the city's upper crust would scoff at, but one she fervently believes in

NineFingers_252.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_252.text: If we take a little tribute in return, or tie strings of service to those we help, well - what of it? So long as we're working as one, it all runs quick, quiet, and clean.
NineFingers_252.context: NodeContext: Acknowledging the Guild's criminal aspects, not shying away

NineFingers_241.speaker: Player
NineFingers_241.text: That's a very utopian way of saying you're a gang of petty thugs.

NineFingers_15.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_15.text: If you'd prefer to trust in the Watch, the Council, the Parliament of Peers - by all means. They're the pretty face slapped over the city.

NineFingers_195.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_195.text: But the Guild is the blood, the bone, the gristle - the ugly bits that actually make Baldur's Gate move.

NineFingers_117.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_117.text: We'll be the ones still holding the Gate when all those others have fled.
NineFingers_117.context: NodeContext: Quiet certainty - this is true, because she will make it so

NineFingers_180.speaker: Player
NineFingers_180.text: I'd trust the Guild over the City Watch and the Flaming Fist any day.

NineFingers_278.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_278.text: The Watch, the Council, even the Parliament of Peers - they're the clean face they want the world to see.

NineFingers_17.speaker: Player
NineFingers_17.text: And what is it the Guild wants?

NineFingers_186.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_186.text: Clean water, filthy riches, and everything in between. We're citizens of the city - no more, no less.

NineFingers_32.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_32.text: Right now, I'll settle for taking our city back.

NineFingers_330.speaker: Player
NineFingers_330.text: I ran into some of your thugs - the Rivington Rats?

NineFingers_52.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_52.text: Oh? Did you enjoy the encounter?
NineFingers_52.context: NodeContext: Raised brows, wry- we're telling us about a crew of her we ran into.

NineFingers_98.speaker: Player
NineFingers_98.text: I had to kill the leader.

NineFingers_141.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_141.text: Zenovia? Always told the girl that mouth would cost her her head.
NineFingers_141.context: NodeContext: Sighing - a young lieutentant of hers attacked us

NineFingers_104.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_104.text: I could wish you'd shown some restraint, but I doubt she'd have returned it.
NineFingers_104.context: NodeContext: Sighing, shrugging - the thug of hers we killed had it coming

NineFingers_270.speaker: Player
NineFingers_270.text: They got a payday out of me.

NineFingers_24.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_24.text: A charitable donation to the good protectors of Rivington - was that the tune they played you?
NineFingers_24.context: NodeContext: Amused - we got scammed by her people

NineFingers_228.speaker: Player
NineFingers_228.text: I don't think they enjoyed it.

NineFingers_197.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_197.text: I have no doubt you gave them a good talking to.
NineFingers_197.context: NodeContext: Wry, grimly amused - player scared the shit out of them

NineFingers_201.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_201.text: Am I supposed to swear vengeance? I heard they'd grown a little... indiscreet.
NineFingers_201.context: NodeContext: Raised brows - we just told her we killed her people

NineFingers_77.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_77.text: Bottom-feeding bruisers, I think you mean.

NineFingers_315.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_315.text: But it takes thugs to keep order outside the walls. The Fist only go there for good lawless fun.
NineFingers_315.context: NodeContext: Acknowleding that her people are thugs, but it's thugs she needs in that neighborhood

NineFingers_273.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_273.text: The Rats usually kept a lid on their nastier notions, but with the Stone Lord business distracting me... some are starting to test the leash.
NineFingers_273.context: NodeContext: Rueful - her control is slipping because of the cult

NineFingers_234.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_234.text: All the more reason to be rid of the cult quickly, so I can remind my crews it's not a leash 'round their necks if they cross me - it's a noose.

NineFingers_196.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_196.text: No time! The Zhentarim have turned, the rot-word bastards. So if you're part of it, take your shot - anything else can wait 'til the Zhent are buried.
NineFingers_196.context: NodeContext: Grim, focused - the Zhent have turned on her and we've found our way into her office

NineFingers_265.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_265.text: Good. Because I've already got more enemies than I do fingers.
NineFingers_265.context: NodeContext: 'Oh, how nice you're not going to kill me today'

NineFingers_3.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_3.context: NodeContext: Without further ado, leading us into the fight

NineFingers_83.speaker: Player
NineFingers_83.text: Nothing personal. The Guild just needs a new master.

NineFingers_30.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_30.text: I disagree. Let's have a friendly debate on the matter, aye?
NineFingers_30.context: NodeContext: Smiling - almost relieved to just get to something as simple as a fight to the death

NineFingers_213.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_213.text: I suppose I should have seen that coming. Zhentarim aren't known for their loyalty, but I thought the bastards would keep to their contract at least.
NineFingers_213.context: NodeContext: Spitting, disdain for the Zhentarim and her own naivety in actually trusting them

NineFingers_124.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_124.text: I'm too nice for my own good, I suppose. But I was in a pit and you helped pull me out - for that, I'm grateful.

NineFingers_137.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_137.text: You'll have what Guild blades I can give when the time to take the Absolute comes. So just tell me what you need to get us there.

NineFingers_217.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_217.text: All hail the Absolute's worst nightmare. How can I help you in your war today?
NineFingers_217.context: NodeContext: Dry. 'Look at this big bad hero'

NineFingers_248.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_248.text: You still look like you need a rest, grandmother. Anything I can do to take that wrinkle from your brow?
NineFingers_248.context: NodeContext: Sourly amused, certain Jaheira is about to be a pain her arse somehow.

AD_Roah_Patrol_14.speaker: Roah Moonglow
AD_Roah_Patrol_14.text: |Alright, I'll be checking in again soon.|

AD_Roah_Patrol_12.speaker: Roah Moonglow
AD_Roah_Patrol_12.text: |Why is Follgast not on his post?|

AD_FetchersBrat_001_GivesOrders_0.speaker: Li'l Fezmor
AD_FetchersBrat_001_GivesOrders_0.text: Happy. Another job - just a little light finger-work this time.

AD_FetchersBrat_001_GivesOrders_5.speaker: Li'l Fezmor
AD_FetchersBrat_001_GivesOrders_5.text: And lost half the coin on the cobbles. I'm giving you a chance to prove you're not a total dunce.
AD_FetchersBrat_001_GivesOrders_5.context: NodeContext: Flat, mercliess - sending fellow kid out on another dangerous stealing job

AD_FetchersBrat_001_GivesOrders_1.speaker: Li'l Fezmor
AD_FetchersBrat_001_GivesOrders_1.text: Happy. Thought I slipped you a job?

AD_FetchersBrat_001_GivesOrders_4.speaker: Happy Hands
AD_FetchersBrat_001_GivesOrders_4.text: Yes, boss. Just, uh... waiting for the right moment.

AD_FetchersBrat_001_GivesOrders_6.speaker: Li'l Fezmor
AD_FetchersBrat_001_GivesOrders_6.text: The right moment is when I told you to do it the first time.
AD_FetchersBrat_001_GivesOrders_6.context: NodeContext: Flat, mercliess - sending fellow kid out on another dangerous stealing job

AD_FetchersBrat_001_GivesOrders_2.speaker: Li'l Fezmor
AD_FetchersBrat_001_GivesOrders_2.text: Take much longer, Happy, and they'll have to call you Smashed Hands instead.
AD_FetchersBrat_001_GivesOrders_2.context: NodeContext: Quietly to self - promising retribution on Happy Hands for taking so long

AD_FetchersBrat_001_GivesOrders_3.speaker: Li'l Fezmor
AD_FetchersBrat_001_GivesOrders_3.context: NodeContext: Quietly to self - waiting for thief to come back from a job.

Zhent_Mercenary_002_3.speaker: Fishbait Arno
Zhent_Mercenary_002_3.context: CinematicNodeContext: Salute - he only grunts, but he's acknowledging we're in charge now.NodeContext: Respectful grunt.

Zhent_Mercenary_002_4.speaker: Fishbait Arno
Zhent_Mercenary_002_4.context: NodeContext: Character who typically only grunts - but reacting with rare surprise to the removal of the Guild crime boss. His group opposed hers, but he did respect her,

AD_Friol_Combat_04_0.speaker: Boss Friol
AD_Friol_Combat_04_0.text: Advance, Zhentarim! No one will weep for these rats!
AD_Friol_Combat_04_0.context: NodeContext: Urging her mercenaries on mid-battle.

Bartender_4.speaker: Severn
Bartender_4.text: Things change but we still get thirsty, right, newcomer?
Bartender_4.context: NodeContext: shrug, slight smile - back to business

Bartender_12.speaker: Severn
Bartender_12.text: A new boss! Makes your fur stand on end, don't it?
Bartender_12.context: NodeContext: a little worried but he's not gonna rock any boats

Bartender_13.speaker: Severn
Bartender_13.text: So the Guild comes out on top! Sometimes, nine fingers are all you need, eh?

Bartender_23.speaker: Severn
Bartender_23.text: Before you ask, I ain't got none o' that plum prosecco. Now, what can I get you, newcomer?

Bartender_17.speaker: Player
Bartender_17.text: What's going on between you and Cheeky Nora? She seems rather eager.

Bartender_22.speaker: Severn
Bartender_22.text: Gah! Nora's what you call an M-F - the M stands for Monster. Let's just say I ain't that type.

Bartender_27.speaker: Severn
Bartender_27.text: Beverages of distinction, or in some cases extinction, if you ain't careful. How you feelin' today? Lucky?

Bartender_8.speaker: Player
Bartender_8.text: Sure. Let's see the liquor list.

Bartender_2.speaker: Player
Bartender_2.text: Luck isn't needed - no drink could take me down.

Bartender_21.speaker: Severn
Bartender_21.text: The last stain I had to clean up off the floor said the same. But go for it.

Bartender_7.speaker: Player
Bartender_7.text: Got any gossip you can share?

Bartender_29.speaker: Severn
Bartender_29.text: Around here silence is golden mate. Best remember that. Now, what can I get you?

Bartender_31.speaker: Severn
Bartender_31.text: No winners, no losers, nothing's changed. But I still ain't got no plum prosecco.

AD_Roah_Combat_03_0.speaker: Roah Moonglow
AD_Roah_Combat_03_0.text: Too late for tears now, my lads!

AD_Bursar_Guard_001_DuringCoup_0.speaker: Snapbone
AD_Bursar_Guard_001_DuringCoup_0.text: Let's see if these Zhentarim bleed gold!

PAD_PlayerTakeoverResponse_0.speaker: Player
PAD_PlayerTakeoverResponse_0.text: All that fighting over this chair - and now there's no one left to sit in it.

PAD_FoundCountingHouseAmbushNote_0.speaker: Player
PAD_FoundCountingHouseAmbushNote_0.text: The Stone Lord plans to rob the Counting House - and Nine-Fingers means to trap him there.

AD_Roah_TakeoverStarts_0.speaker: Roah Moonglow
AD_Roah_TakeoverStarts_0.text: Diplomacy won't do it, lads - we'll do it the other way!
AD_Roah_TakeoverStarts_0.context: NodeContext: Calling out to your crew to attack - faux-shrug, like 'oh well, we tried'

AD_Bodyguard_001_DuringCoup_0.speaker: Lady Ague
AD_Bodyguard_001_DuringCoup_0.text: Pick your marks. The moment will come.
AD_Bodyguard_001_DuringCoup_0.context: NodeContext: Tone is easy, casual - her fighters are chomping at the bit she's keeping control.

AD_Zhent_Mercenary_008_DuringCoup_0.speaker: Follgast
AD_Zhent_Mercenary_008_DuringCoup_0.text: Until the boss gives word, hold the line.

AD_FetchersBrat_002_LootingCorpses_0.speaker: Sticky Dondo
AD_FetchersBrat_002_LootingCorpses_0.context: NodeContext: Repeating lines while kid loots corpse.

AD_Zhent_Mercenary_005_DuringCoup_0.speaker: Lugarrio
AD_Zhent_Mercenary_005_DuringCoup_0.context: NodeContext: Revved up, chomping at the bit as you face your enemy - but waiting for the order to actually fight

AD_Roah_Combat_02_0.speaker: Roah Moonglow
AD_Roah_Combat_02_0.text: Just lie down now, lads - we'll make it gentle!

AD_Zhent_Leader_Patrol_14.speaker: Boss Friol
AD_Zhent_Leader_Patrol_14.text: |Alright, I'll be checking in again soon.|

AD_Zhent_Leader_Patrol_12.speaker: Boss Friol
AD_Zhent_Leader_Patrol_12.text: |Why is Follgast not on his post?|

AD_Visitor_004_ChecksInWith_ThiefHideout.speaker: Floridor
AD_Visitor_004_ChecksInWith_ThiefHideout.text: Is that special recipe ready yet? Just checking.

AD_Visitor_004_ChecksInWith_ThiefHideout.speaker: Mol
AD_Visitor_004_ChecksInWith_ThiefHideout.text: 'Fraid not, saer. We're still gathering the, you know, special fluid.

AD_Visitor_004_ChecksInWith_ThiefHideout.speaker: Floridor
AD_Visitor_004_ChecksInWith_ThiefHideout.text: All right. I'll try to be patient. But he's eager.

AD_Visitor_004_ChecksInWith_ThiefHideout.speaker: Floridor
AD_Visitor_004_ChecksInWith_ThiefHideout.text: Hi, it's me again! Just wondering about that recipe.

AD_Visitor_004_ChecksInWith_ThiefHideout.speaker: Mol
AD_Visitor_004_ChecksInWith_ThiefHideout.text: We're working on it, all right? It's got, like, three different viscosities in it.

AD_Visitor_004_ChecksInWith_ThiefHideout.speaker: Floridor
AD_Visitor_004_ChecksInWith_ThiefHideout.text: Very well, very well. I don't want to upset the process.

AD_Visitor_004_ChecksInWith_ThiefHideout.speaker: Floridor
AD_Visitor_004_ChecksInWith_ThiefHideout.text: Really, I must insist on delivery of my order!

AD_Visitor_004_ChecksInWith_ThiefHideout.speaker: Mol
AD_Visitor_004_ChecksInWith_ThiefHideout.text: Now you've done it! The middle slime layers have inverted. I'm going to have to start over.

AD_Visitor_004_ChecksInWith_ThiefHideout.speaker: Floridor
AD_Visitor_004_ChecksInWith_ThiefHideout.text: Son of a lich! All right, start over, then.

AD_Visitor_004_ChecksInWith_ThiefHideout.speaker: Floridor
AD_Visitor_004_ChecksInWith_ThiefHideout.text: Does it always take this long? Nothing went wrong, did it?

AD_Visitor_004_ChecksInWith_ThiefHideout.speaker: Mol
AD_Visitor_004_ChecksInWith_ThiefHideout.text: Please, lady! Strong emotions can mess up the settling of the humours!

AD_Visitor_004_ChecksInWith_ThiefHideout.speaker: Floridor
AD_Visitor_004_ChecksInWith_ThiefHideout.text: I... I guess I don't want the humours messed up, do I?

AD_Visitor_004_ChecksInWith_FetchersBrat.speaker: Floridor
AD_Visitor_004_ChecksInWith_FetchersBrat.text: Does it always take this long? Nothing went wrong, did it?

AD_Visitor_004_ChecksInWith_FetchersBrat.speaker: Li'l Fezmor
AD_Visitor_004_ChecksInWith_FetchersBrat.text: Please, lady! Strong emotions can mess up the settling of the humours!

AD_Visitor_004_ChecksInWith_FetchersBrat.speaker: Floridor
AD_Visitor_004_ChecksInWith_FetchersBrat.text: I... I guess I don't want the humours messed up, do I?

AD_Visitor_004_ChecksInWith_FetchersBrat.speaker: Floridor
AD_Visitor_004_ChecksInWith_FetchersBrat.text: Hi, it's me again! Just wondering about that recipe.

AD_Visitor_004_ChecksInWith_FetchersBrat.speaker: Li'l Fezmor
AD_Visitor_004_ChecksInWith_FetchersBrat.text: We're working on it, all right? It's got, like, three different viscosities in it.

AD_Visitor_004_ChecksInWith_FetchersBrat.speaker: Floridor
AD_Visitor_004_ChecksInWith_FetchersBrat.text: Very well, very well. I don't want to upset the process.

AD_Visitor_004_ChecksInWith_FetchersBrat.speaker: Floridor
AD_Visitor_004_ChecksInWith_FetchersBrat.text: Is that special recipe ready yet? Just checking.

AD_Visitor_004_ChecksInWith_FetchersBrat.speaker: Li'l Fezmor
AD_Visitor_004_ChecksInWith_FetchersBrat.text: 'Fraid not, saer. We're still gathering the, you know, special fluid.

AD_Visitor_004_ChecksInWith_FetchersBrat.speaker: Floridor
AD_Visitor_004_ChecksInWith_FetchersBrat.text: All right. I'll try to be patient. But he's eager.

AD_Visitor_004_ChecksInWith_FetchersBrat.speaker: Floridor
AD_Visitor_004_ChecksInWith_FetchersBrat.text: Really, I must insist on delivery of my order!

AD_Visitor_004_ChecksInWith_FetchersBrat.speaker: Li'l Fezmor
AD_Visitor_004_ChecksInWith_FetchersBrat.text: Now you've done it! The middle slime layers have inverted. I'm going to have to start over.

AD_Visitor_004_ChecksInWith_FetchersBrat.speaker: Floridor
AD_Visitor_004_ChecksInWith_FetchersBrat.text: Son of a lich! All right, start over, then.

AD_Friol_Combat_01_0.speaker: Boss Friol
AD_Friol_Combat_01_0.text: Nine fingers and no friends. The guildmaster should've seen this coming.

Member_008_0.speaker: Blades Bakstir
Member_008_0.text: A word of advice, new-Nine-Fingers - open the gates to this army. If the Zhent smelled profit in it, you know there's gold to be had.

Member_008_1.speaker: Blades Bakstir
Member_008_1.text: We keep the peace, until this army is dealt with. Then the Zhentarim learn the Guild goes much deeper than the Guildhall alone.
Member_008_1.context: NodeContext: Relishing overthrowing the Zhent when all this is done.

Member_008_2.speaker: Blades Bakstir
Member_008_2.text: Look now - the guildmaster's little hunt is bringing all sorts of new faces out of the woodwork.

Member_008_3.speaker: Blades Bakstir
Member_008_3.text: See? All that bloodshed, and not a Stone Lord to be seen. I reckon Tut made him up.

Member_008_4.speaker: Blades Bakstir
Member_008_4.text: You seem to have Nine-Fingers' ear - get her to open the gates to this army. If the Zhent smelled profit in it, you know there's gold to be had.

Member_008_5.speaker: Blades Bakstir
Member_008_5.text: Don't much like the notion of bowing to the Zhentarim. Don't reckon they'll keep us bowing for very long, either.
Member_008_5.context: NodeContext: mild - a mercenary group has taken over the Guildhall, but you know they won't hold it for long

Member_008_7.speaker: Blades Bakstir
Member_008_7.text: You'd think this Stone Lord ruled some layer of Hell, the way everyone's going on about him.

AD_BossFriol_TakeoverStarts_0.speaker: Boss Friol
AD_BossFriol_TakeoverStarts_0.text: Ah, good. I was hoping it would come to this. ZHENTARIM - TO ARMS!
AD_BossFriol_TakeoverStarts_0.context: NodeContext: Giving up on negotiations - calling her Zhent to arms.

AD_BursarCounting_0.speaker: Uktar
AD_BursarCounting_0.context: NodeContext: Spoken softly to himself - player has raided his chest and he's confused

AD_BursarCounting_1.speaker: Uktar
AD_BursarCounting_1.text: Hmm. No tribute from some of the crews this month. We have the Stone Lord to thank for that.

AD_BursarCounting_3.speaker: Uktar
AD_BursarCounting_3.text: I'll have to have the Brats turn out their pockets.
AD_BursarCounting_3.context: NodeContext: Spoken softly to himself - player has raided his chest and he's confused

AD_BursarCounting_5.speaker: Uktar
AD_BursarCounting_5.text: Eyes to yourself while I take inventory.
AD_BursarCounting_5.context: NodeContext: Spoken idly to his guards nearby

AD_BursarCounting_6.speaker: Uktar
AD_BursarCounting_6.text: No Guild crew would raid my coffers. They're not that stupid.
AD_BursarCounting_6.context: NodeContext: Spoken softly to himself - player has raided his chest and he's confused

AD_BursarCounting_7.speaker: Uktar
AD_BursarCounting_7.context: NodeContext: Spoken softly to himself - player has raided his chest and he's confused

AD_Zhent_LeaderBackup_TakeoverCancelled_.speaker: Trinoda
AD_Zhent_LeaderBackup_TakeoverCancelled_.text: Shite. Can't fulfil the contract without a crew...
AD_Zhent_LeaderBackup_TakeoverCancelled_.context: NodeContext: A little thrown - you can't stage the coup you were paid to as most of your soldiers are dead.

AD_FetchersBrat_003_LootingCorpses_0.speaker: Happy Hands
AD_FetchersBrat_003_LootingCorpses_0.text: You won't mind if I just...
AD_FetchersBrat_003_LootingCorpses_0.context: NodeContext: Repeating line while kid loots corpse

AD_NineFingers_AfterCoup_0.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
AD_NineFingers_AfterCoup_0.text: That's enough gawking, all. Back to work - there's a mess needs cleaning up here.
AD_NineFingers_AfterCoup_0.context: NodeContext: Calling out to her assembled Guild members as the battle winds down and she goes back to her office. Casual - the Zhentarim she just slaughtered aren't even worth a second thought.

Zhent_LeaderBackup_0.speaker: Trinoda
Zhent_LeaderBackup_0.text: Hold it there! Bad time to come a-visiting, my friend.

Zhent_LeaderBackup_1.speaker: Trinoda
Zhent_LeaderBackup_1.text: This is Zhentarim territory now, just as soon as we've purged it of Guild rats. Nothing personal.

AD_Roah_TakeoverEasy_0.speaker: Roah Moonglow
AD_Roah_TakeoverEasy_0.text: Where did all the Guildies go...? Well, it'll make this a little easier.
AD_Roah_TakeoverEasy_0.context: NodeContext: Faint surprise at the fact that there's no one left to resist her coup.

AD_Zhent_LeaderBackup_DuringCoup_0.speaker: Trinoda
AD_Zhent_LeaderBackup_DuringCoup_0.text: Clock's ticking, Guildies! Will it be Nine-Fingers alone, or all of you with her?
AD_Zhent_LeaderBackup_DuringCoup_0.context: NodeContext: Calling out to Guild with threat / offer - she'll give the order to have them all killed if they don't hand over NF.

Bard_0.speaker: Lyrux Goldthroat
Bard_0.text: I'm sorry, sweetie pie - I don't do requests. But toss me a few coppers and I'll shoot you a saucy wink across the bar.

Bard_9.speaker: Lyrux Goldthroat
Bard_9.text: I could smell the good taste on you the moment you walked over here. Maybe I'll even throw in that saucy wink for free.

Bard_4.speaker: Lyrux Goldthroat
Bard_4.text: Suit yourself - I guess some folks don't appreciate a good ditty well played.

Bard_1.speaker: Lyrux Goldthroat
Bard_1.text: Very kind of you, saer. I'll be dedicating the next keening elven ballad to you - you look like the type to enjoy one.

Bard_2.speaker: Player
Bard_2.text: Nice gig you've got here - colour me envious.

Bard_13.speaker: Lyrux Goldthroat
Bard_13.text: It isn't half bad, is it? And this lot? Very generous tippers.

Bard_12.speaker: Lyrux Goldthroat
Bard_12.text: I'm sure you understand there's only room for one bard here, but I'll let you know if I need a day off, hm?

Bard_5.speaker: Player
Bard_5.text: Do you... do you know any songs from a Dragonborn bard called 'Quil'?

Bard_3.speaker: Player
Bard_3.text: A bard of my homeland! Do you know any songs of Abeir?

Bard_10.speaker: Lyrux Goldthroat
Bard_10.text: Of course I do. But I find a Baldurian audience prefers Baldurian songs, so if you'd be so kind - step aside to make room for the coins to fall.

Bard_8.speaker: Lyrux Goldthroat
Bard_8.text: Now, now - if you keep talking to me, these folks won't get their money's worth of melodies. Take a lean and open those pretty little ears.

Member_009_0.speaker: Three-Piece
Member_009_0.context: NodeContext: warily respectful - we've just earned this new title and he's unsure what kind of master we'll be.

Member_009_1.speaker: Three-Piece
Member_009_1.text: Call me an old fart if you want, but there was a time the Zhentarim stuck to their contracts. No honour - none.
Member_009_1.context: NodeContext: Bellyaching - things were better in your day

Member_009_2.speaker: Three-Piece
Member_009_2.text: Make sure to get your share of the Zhentish loot. Nine-Fingers favours a fair split.

Member_009_3.speaker: Three-Piece
Member_009_3.context: NodeContext: Friendly, fobbing us off - he's already said he doesn't want to speak to us

Member_009_4.speaker: Three-Piece
Member_009_4.text: Keep a blade close. Won't be long before the Stone Lord and his crew come knocking, mark my words.

Member_009_5.speaker: Three-Piece
Member_009_5.text: No offence, mate, but I'd keep to your own crew. This Stone Lord's got everyone feeling a mite unsociable.
Member_009_5.context: NodeContext: A word of friendly advice - everyone standing around the guildhall is tense and clustered in their own groups.

Member_009_6.speaker: Three-Piece
Member_009_6.text: D'you hear? Stone Lord bloody slipped Nine-Fingers' net, again.
Member_009_6.context: NodeContext: Hushed tones - he could get in trouble for his bellyaching

Bodyguard_004_0.speaker: Lady Lockjaw
Bodyguard_004_0.context: NodeContext: Pushed to answer how she'd kill us, shrugging and lack-lustre in making it intimidating

Bodyguard_004_1.speaker: Lady Lockjaw
Bodyguard_004_1.context: NodeContext: Eyeing us up, picking a name they'd give us if we had to join their Court

Bodyguard_004_2.speaker: Lady Lockjaw
Bodyguard_004_2.text: We serve her still, and so do you.
Bodyguard_004_2.context: NodeContext: Mask of stoic duty over grief - she's repeating this mantra as a symbol of loyalty to her dead leader.

Bodyguard_004_3.speaker: Lady Lockjaw
Bodyguard_004_3.text: What, Lady Ague still playing that game? I don't have one ready.
Bodyguard_004_3.context: NodeContext: Pushed to answer how she'd kill us, shrugging and lack-lustre in making it intimidating

AD_Zhent_LeaderBackup_TakeoverCancelled_.speaker: Trinoda
AD_Zhent_LeaderBackup_TakeoverCancelled_.text: Shite. What the hells happened to the crew? May need to change tack...
AD_Zhent_LeaderBackup_TakeoverCancelled_.context: NodeContext: Thrown - you've showed up for a coup only to find your crews dead / dying - you can't go ahead with it

AD_Zhent_Mercenary_008_AfterCoup_0.speaker: Follgast
AD_Zhent_Mercenary_008_AfterCoup_0.text: That's it, lads! Get comfortable - we just won ourselves a new hidey-hole.
AD_Zhent_Mercenary_008_AfterCoup_0.context: NodeContext: Cheerfully calling out to troops after winning a battle for the Guildhall

Zhent_Mercenary_006_0.speaker: Phase
Zhent_Mercenary_006_0.text: Maybe you can set your sights on a dukedom next, eh?

Zhent_Mercenary_006_1.speaker: Phase
Zhent_Mercenary_006_1.text: Keene might look down on the Zhentarim, but she'll be glad of us once the Stone Lord comes knocking.

Zhent_Mercenary_006_2.speaker: Phase
Zhent_Mercenary_006_2.text: Hah! You and the boss turned Nine-Fingers over in a bloody afternoon.

Zhent_Mercenary_006_4.speaker: Phase
Zhent_Mercenary_006_4.text: The Guild's no army, however tough they act. Just twenty different thieving crews, come to hide behind Nine-Fingers' skirts.

AD_FetchersBrat_001_LootingCorpses_0.speaker: Li'l Fezmor
AD_FetchersBrat_001_LootingCorpses_0.context: NodeContext: Repeating lines as the child loots corpses after a battle.

Bodyguard_000_1.speaker: Lady Flux
Bodyguard_000_1.text: We serve her still, and so do you.
Bodyguard_000_1.context: NodeContext: Repeated like a loyal soldier's mantra. A warning that even though Nine-FIngers is dead, her bodyguards will ensure her will is carried out

Bodyguard_000_2.speaker: Lady Flux
Bodyguard_000_2.context: NodeContext: Considering. All members of this elite bodyguard state only the name they'd give us if we were to join their ranks

Bodyguard_000_4.speaker: Lady Flux
Bodyguard_000_4.context: NodeContext: Matter of fact - all the members of this elite bodyguard only answer us by stating the way they'd kill us (their leader explains)

AD_Ninefingers_Combat_03_0.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
AD_Ninefingers_Combat_03_0.text: There won't be graves for you. Just rats grown too fat for the sewers.

Member_002_0.speaker: Mango
Member_002_0.text: Guildhall is not what it was. No gambling. No blood-games. Not even a pissy little peacock fight. BORED!

Member_002_1.speaker: Mango
Member_002_1.text: Don't expect to see any fun return to this place so long as those jackboots are thumping around.
Member_002_1.context: NodeContext: Telling us the Zhentarim are no craic

Member_002_2.speaker: Mango
Member_002_2.text: Nine-Fingers will be missed. Right up until every other bastard here tries to fill her chair, at least.

Member_002_4.speaker: Mango
Member_002_4.text: So it seems the Stone Lord was a fake. Coward didn't even turn up to fight!

Member_002_11.speaker: Minsc
Member_002_11.context: NodeContext: Starting to speak up in protest at inadvertently being called a coward, but stops at a squeak from Boo. Then continues from next line, a little sulkily.

Member_002_3.speaker: Minsc
Member_002_3.text: Hmph. Yes, Boo - a coward indeed.

Member_002_5.speaker: Mango
Member_002_5.text: Zhentarim in charge? We might have been better off with the Stone Lord.

Member_002_7.speaker: Mango
Member_002_7.text: Nine-Fingers gone. She had an heir-apparent, once, but... no one, now.

Member_002_8.speaker: Mango
Member_002_8.text: Stone Lord was a fraud, but at least our guildmaster's the real thing.

Member_002_9.speaker: Mango
Member_002_9.text: Go bat your eyelashes at the Lady's Court. Pick the wrong pocket. Anything for some action - please.

Member_002_12.speaker: Mango
Member_002_12.text: Maybe the Stone Lord's bringing the battle to this place next. Fingers crossed, eh?

Member_002_13.speaker: Mango
Member_002_13.text: I hear the Stone Lord burst out from under Glitterbeard's chamber pot and ate him up whole. Finally - some action.

AD_Zhent_LeaderBackup_TakeoverStarts_0.speaker: Trinoda
AD_Zhent_LeaderBackup_TakeoverStarts_0.context: NodeContext: Calling your fellow Zhentarim to arms - battle starts after this

FetchersBrat_003_0.speaker: Happy Hands
FetchersBrat_003_0.text: Don't bug me, I'm making plans. Big plans, see?

AD_MinscEnteringBar_0.speaker: Minsc
AD_MinscEnteringBar_0.text: Ugh. A stinking den of dregs and - ooh, is that Rashemi firewine?!
AD_MinscEnteringBar_0.context: NodeContext: Begins full of disgust for the Guild hideout - then sees they're serving his brand

AD_BossFriol_TakeoverEasy_0.speaker: Boss Friol
AD_BossFriol_TakeoverEasy_0.text: Huh. Guild numbers seem thinner than they were. Well - they might just thank us for taking charge.
AD_BossFriol_TakeoverEasy_0.context: NodeContext: Entering Guildhall to see most of its fighters are dead. She was planning a hostile takeover that just got a lot easier. Shrugs, and carries on with her plan.

AD_Intro_Member_001_Zhent_Mercenary_001_.speaker: Slick Inatra
AD_Intro_Member_001_Zhent_Mercenary_001_.text: We're all on the same side, friend. Nine-Fingers invited us herself.
AD_Intro_Member_001_Zhent_Mercenary_001_.context: NodeContext: Placating - you and your soldiers are causing paranoia among the Guild members

AD_Intro_Member_001_Zhent_Mercenary_001_.speaker: The Professor
AD_Intro_Member_001_Zhent_Mercenary_001_.text: The guildmaster hired you, yes - but I think it's best if your Zhentarim keep to themselves. There's not a lot of trust in the Guildhall of late.
AD_Intro_Member_001_Zhent_Mercenary_001_.context: NodeContext: Trying to be diplomatic, but firm

AD_Intro_Member_001_Zhent_Mercenary_001_.speaker: Slick Inatra
AD_Intro_Member_001_Zhent_Mercenary_001_.text: You're all scared shitless of this Stone Lord, you mean. Which is exactly why your boss hired us.
AD_Intro_Member_001_Zhent_Mercenary_001_.context: NodeContext: Snorting, not buying the diplomacy

AD_Intro_Member_001_Zhent_Mercenary_001_.speaker: Slick Inatra
AD_Intro_Member_001_Zhent_Mercenary_001_.text: Look, if your lot could look after themselves, we wouldn't need to be here.
AD_Intro_Member_001_Zhent_Mercenary_001_.context: NodeContext: Gruff soldier trying to reason with a clerk

AD_Intro_Member_001_Zhent_Mercenary_001_.speaker: The Professor
AD_Intro_Member_001_Zhent_Mercenary_001_.text: The Guild is a collective of specialists - not a private army.
AD_Intro_Member_001_Zhent_Mercenary_001_.context: NodeContext: A little huffy - you look down on hired muscle

AD_Intro_Member_001_Zhent_Mercenary_001_.speaker: Slick Inatra
AD_Intro_Member_001_Zhent_Mercenary_001_.text: 'Specialists'. Thieves, con-artists, and killers - nothing so special about that, friend.

AD_Intro_Member_001_Zhent_Mercenary_001_.speaker: The Professor
AD_Intro_Member_001_Zhent_Mercenary_001_.text: ...There are no killers here, Zhent. Assassins, those are a different matter entirely.
AD_Intro_Member_001_Zhent_Mercenary_001_.context: NodeContext: Still huffy, but pausing to relent. The Guild aren't murderers, but sure - they'll kill someone for coin.

AD_Intro_Member_001_Zhent_Mercenary_001_.speaker: Slick Inatra
AD_Intro_Member_001_Zhent_Mercenary_001_.text: And what are we meant to do about food?
AD_Intro_Member_001_Zhent_Mercenary_001_.context: NodeContext: Sighing, quibbling over one last detail

AD_Intro_Member_001_Zhent_Mercenary_001_.speaker: The Professor
AD_Intro_Member_001_Zhent_Mercenary_001_.text: Talk to Severn at the bar.

AD_Intro_Member_001_Zhent_Mercenary_001_.speaker: The Professor
AD_Intro_Member_001_Zhent_Mercenary_001_.text: The guildmaster poached him from a minor peer of Parliament. He's quite the cook.

AD_Intro_Member_001_Zhent_Mercenary_001_.speaker: The Professor
AD_Intro_Member_001_Zhent_Mercenary_001_.text: As you'll see, there's plenty of space for your people.
AD_Intro_Member_001_Zhent_Mercenary_001_.context: NodeContext: Stiff clerk, trying to shunt the Zhentarim off into a dark corner

AD_Intro_Member_001_Zhent_Mercenary_001_.speaker: Slick Inatra
AD_Intro_Member_001_Zhent_Mercenary_001_.text: Down there in the damp, you mean.

AD_Intro_Member_001_Zhent_Mercenary_001_.speaker: The Professor
AD_Intro_Member_001_Zhent_Mercenary_001_.text: Count yourself lucky. This place is usually so full that you wouldn't find room to sit your padded arse down.

AD_Intro_Member_001_Zhent_Mercenary_001_.speaker: Slick Inatra
AD_Intro_Member_001_Zhent_Mercenary_001_.text: Don't try to flirt with me, boss. We both know this place is like a tomb because your crews are running scared.
AD_Intro_Member_001_Zhent_Mercenary_001_.context: NodeContext: Wry, smiling - she's making the clerk uncomfortable

AD_BossFriol_DuringCoup_0.speaker: Boss Friol
AD_BossFriol_DuringCoup_0.text: We just want Nine-Fingers! The rest of you swear fealty to the Zhent, and we leave you to your business.
AD_BossFriol_DuringCoup_0.context: NodeContext: Calling out to group of soldiers in a standoff. Her Zhentarim want to depose Nine-Fingers - Friol is trying to reason with the Guild not to fight.

Member_001_5.speaker: The Professor
Member_001_5.text: If you need any ideas on how this place should run, just look to me.
Member_001_5.context: NodeContext: Eager, wants to ingratiate himself with us

Member_001_7.speaker: The Professor
Member_001_7.text: So do we just... sign up? Get Zhentarim kit of our own?
Member_001_7.context: NodeContext: Nonplussed, uncertain what to do next.

Member_001_14.speaker: The Professor
Member_001_14.text: Nine-Fingers was the only thing keeping the kingpins united. I doubt the Zhentarim can do the same, no matter how pretty their uniforms are.
Member_001_14.context: NodeContext: Doubt for the future - just because the Zhent are in control doesn't mean things are better.

Member_001_17.speaker: The Professor
Member_001_17.text: That chair's yours for the taking. Better than leaving it absent for these clowns to fight over.
Member_001_17.context: NodeContext: Eager, wants to ingratiate himself with us

Member_001_21.speaker: The Professor
Member_001_21.text: Didn't think the Zhentarim would turn on us so easily. Inatra seemed... honest, gods help me.
Member_001_21.context: NodeContext: Nonplussed, know he sounds naive to have trusted a merc.

Member_001_24.speaker: The Professor
Member_001_24.text: You rid us of our Stone Lord problem. Just a pity you didn't settle a payday with Nine-Fingers first, eh?
Member_001_24.context: NodeContext: Making a weak joke about our success - a little intimidated by us

Member_001_25.speaker: The Professor
Member_001_25.text: Remember - no distracting the Zhent. We want them sharp if the Stone Lord comes calling.

Member_001_45.speaker: The Professor
Member_001_45.text: Right, which crew are you with? Bell-Breakers? The Children of Hoar?

Member_001_3.speaker: Narrator
Member_001_3.text: *The names ring familiar: two of the many crews that make up the Guild, a loose collective with ties to every criminal enterprise in the city's underworld.*

Member_001_6.speaker: Player
Member_001_6.text: Neither. I run a crew called the Wormskulls.

Member_001_42.speaker: The Professor
Member_001_42.text: Can't say I've heard of you. Spare me the story behind the name - I'm sure it's very scary.

Member_001_19.speaker: The Professor
Member_001_19.text: I'm sure you call yourselves that - but there's no crew paying tribute under that name. And you don't want to owe the Guild money.

Member_001_0.speaker: The Professor
Member_001_0.text: Fair warning - the guildmaster wants no fraternising with the Zhentarim. They're here to work, not to share war stories.

Member_001_26.speaker: The Professor
Member_001_26.text: They won't be much use to us if they're drinking and dicing when the Stone Lord kicks the door down.

Member_001_12.speaker: Player
Member_001_12.text: I know something of the Stone Lord. You'll want your Zhentarim at their best.

Member_001_38.speaker: The Professor
Member_001_38.text: You're one of the few alive who know anything about him, then.

Member_001_10.speaker: The Professor
Member_001_10.text: The latest challenger to the Guild's position. But probably the first one to actually make us sweat.

Member_001_13.speaker: The Professor
Member_001_13.text: He came out of nowhere and ate up half our turf in a tenday. So if you're speaking to the guildmaster, maybe step soft around the topic, hm?

Member_001_18.speaker: Player
Member_001_18.text: Nine-Fingers is planning to take the Stone Lord down first. I need to know where.

Member_001_40.speaker: The Professor
Member_001_40.text: Looking to prove yourself, are you? Carve your name in the guildmaster's good books?

Member_001_16.speaker: The Professor
Member_001_16.text: Nice to see a little ambition amongst the smaller crews. I can't help you, but look around for a halfling named Tut.

Member_001_23.speaker: The Professor
Member_001_23.text: Nine-Fingers has been known to pour her secrets in his ear, time to time. Maybe 'cos he rinses them out with wine.

Member_001_39.speaker: Player
Member_001_39.text: You're so sure the Stone Lord is going to attack?

Member_001_27.speaker: The Professor
Member_001_27.text: Well whoever he is, he doesn't seem very keen on talking.

Member_001_29.speaker: Player
Member_001_29.text: I didn't think I'd ever see the Guild and the Zhentarim working together.

Member_001_22.speaker: The Professor
Member_001_22.text: You won't. The Black Network is working for us. The Guild is hardly a soft target, but we're not set up for the turf war the Stone Lord's set on fighting.

Member_001_36.speaker: Player
Member_001_36.text: I'd like to speak to the guildmaster.

Member_001_33.speaker: The Professor
Member_001_33.text: Up the stairs. She keeps an open door - to those who don't waste her time, anyway.

Member_001_32.speaker: The Professor
Member_001_32.text: In between scores, then? There's no shame in that. This Stone Lord business has even the bigger crews shutting up shop for a while.

Member_001_30.speaker: Player
Member_001_30.text: I'm not with any crew. Why?

Member_001_34.speaker: Player
Member_001_34.text: 'Child of Hoar'? Is that an insult?

Member_001_41.speaker: The Professor
Member_001_41.text: It's a gang. Pious thugs worshipping the god of petty justice. If you'd met them, you'd probably have a brand on your head - so, steer clear.

AD_Zhent_Mercenary_002_DuringCoup_0.speaker: Fishbait Arno
AD_Zhent_Mercenary_002_DuringCoup_0.context: NodeContext: Everyone around you is getting revved up with battle cries. You're still just grunting.

AD_Roah_DuringCoup_0.speaker: Roah Moonglow
AD_Roah_DuringCoup_0.text: Decide quickly, Guild-folk. Nine-Fingers, or all of you!
AD_Roah_DuringCoup_0.context: NodeContext: Calling out to Guild with threat / offer - she'll give the order to have them all killed if they don't hand over NF.

AD_Ninefingers_Combat_02_0.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
AD_Ninefingers_Combat_02_0.text: I'll be revising the terms of our deal, Zhentarim. Gold for steel.

AD_Bodyguard_004_DuringCoup_0.speaker: Lady Lockjaw
AD_Bodyguard_004_DuringCoup_0.text: Oh, come on. I dare you.
AD_Bodyguard_004_DuringCoup_0.context: NodeContext: Seething - the guild is in a standoff with the Zhentarim, with each side waiting for the other to strike the first blow.

AD_Friol_Combat_03_0.speaker: Boss Friol
AD_Friol_Combat_03_0.text: Remember, Zhentarim - whatever you can take is yours!
AD_Friol_Combat_03_0.context: NodeContext: Mid battle cry, urging on her mercenaries

Zhent_Mercenary_009_0.speaker: Lacy Dancer
Zhent_Mercenary_009_0.text: Go on. Technically, I'm supposed to be on watch.

Zhent_Mercenary_009_2.speaker: Lacy Dancer
Zhent_Mercenary_009_2.text: I'd heard so much about the Lady's Court. Pity they didn't live up to the legend.

Zhent_Mercenary_009_4.speaker: Lacy Dancer
Zhent_Mercenary_009_4.text: The Guild and the Network have been circling like stray dogs for years. 'Bout time we lay down together.

Zhent_Mercenary_009_5.speaker: Lacy Dancer
Zhent_Mercenary_009_5.text: Happened so bloody fast. We just got word to take arms. Surely Nine-Fingers made the first move...?

Zhent_Mercenary_009_7.speaker: Lacy Dancer
Zhent_Mercenary_009_7.text: Word is that Keene messed up her last chance to get the Stone Lord. Boss won't like that.

AD_Ninefingers_Combat_04_0.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
AD_Ninefingers_Combat_04_0.text: Behold the Zhentarim - those too dumb to make it in the Guild!

Zhent_Mercenary_008_0.speaker: Follgast
Zhent_Mercenary_008_0.text: Maybe that's why this Stone Lord is pushing so hard - he wants Keene's underroads all to himself.

Zhent_Mercenary_008_1.speaker: Follgast
Zhent_Mercenary_008_1.text: Don't let the quiet fool you - Zhent contacts say the sewers down here are livelier than ever.

Zhent_Mercenary_008_2.speaker: Follgast
Zhent_Mercenary_008_2.text: The Guild's a Zhentarim outfit now. Keene's crews will forget she ever existed, once their cuts start getting bigger.

Zhent_Mercenary_008_3.speaker: Follgast
Zhent_Mercenary_008_3.text: Pity it had to come to this. My dad knew this place, back before Keene took over.

Zhent_Mercenary_005_0.speaker: Lugarrio
Zhent_Mercenary_005_0.text: Used to come down here a lot when I was a Fist. For, eh, inspections, like.
Zhent_Mercenary_005_0.context: NodeContext: 'Here' is the den of vice of that is the Guildhall, and it definitely was not for 'inspections'.

Zhent_Mercenary_005_1.speaker: Lugarrio
Zhent_Mercenary_005_1.text: Let's hope the Zhentarim are a little more generous with their cuts than the Fist were, eh?

Zhent_Mercenary_005_2.speaker: Lugarrio
Zhent_Mercenary_005_2.text: Uniform's a bit patchy, I know. I was Flaming Fist, but the writing's on the wall there - the Steel Watch will be snatching up our contracts in no time.

Zhent_Mercenary_005_3.speaker: Lugarrio
Zhent_Mercenary_005_3.text: Flaming Fist have been afraid to take Keene on for years - and the Zhentarim did it in an afternoon. I think I picked the right side.

Visitor_002_0.speaker: Hans Feather
Visitor_002_0.text: Best of luck with the new boss.

Visitor_002_1.speaker: Hans Feather
Visitor_002_1.text: Best of luck, boss. You've got some big bad boots to fill.

Visitor_002_2.speaker: Hans Feather
Visitor_002_2.text: Ain't no place for me here among the Zhentarim. Back to being a footman it is.

Visitor_002_3.speaker: Hans Feather
Visitor_002_3.text: Never thought anyone would have the stones to take on Nine-Fingers like that. They damn well won't try it again.

Visitor_002_4.speaker: Hans Feather
Visitor_002_4.text: No distractions, mate. Nine-Fingers has me watching over Peer Priss here - wants her friends from Parliament close, with this new duke making moves.

Visitor_002_5.speaker: Hans Feather
Visitor_002_5.text: You're in well with the boss - don't squander it.

Visitor_002_6.speaker: Hans Feather
Visitor_002_6.text: Ain't see much need for Parliament, myself. I'm more of a monarchist - just a little more glamorous, isn't it?

Visitor_002_7.speaker: Hans Feather
Visitor_002_7.text: No place for me here without Nine-Fingers in charge. I'll see if any of our 'friends in Parliament' need a footman or something.

AD_Bursar_Guards_Banter_0.speaker: Snapbone
AD_Bursar_Guards_Banter_0.text: The Lady's Court. Did you ever... socialise with any of them?

AD_Bursar_Guards_Banter_7.speaker: Elliot
AD_Bursar_Guards_Banter_7.text: Played cards with Lockjaw a few times. Bit testy when you call her bluffs.
AD_Bursar_Guards_Banter_7.context: NodeContext: Actually answering the question, doesn't take his friend's creepy tone up.

AD_Bursar_Guards_Banter_9.speaker: Snapbone
AD_Bursar_Guards_Banter_9.text: Heh, that's not quite the kind of game I'm talking about.

AD_Bursar_Guards_Banter_2.speaker: Elliot
AD_Bursar_Guards_Banter_2.text: Keep talking like that, and they'll call you Snapbone for another reason.
AD_Bursar_Guards_Banter_2.context: NodeContext: Flatly delivered. His friend Snapbone wants to hit on a member of the Lady's Court, the elite bodyguard of the Guild leader

AD_Bursar_Guards_Banter_1.speaker: Snapbone
AD_Bursar_Guards_Banter_1.text: Elliot. Kind of name is Elliot for an orc, anyway?
AD_Bursar_Guards_Banter_1.context: NodeContext: Bored guard, picking up on any idle topic that comes to mind.

AD_Bursar_Guards_Banter_11.speaker: Elliot
AD_Bursar_Guards_Banter_11.text: The one my daddy gave me.
AD_Bursar_Guards_Banter_11.context: NodeContext: Flat, disinterested - not taking bait

AD_Bursar_Guards_Banter_10.speaker: Snapbone
AD_Bursar_Guards_Banter_10.text: Not short for anything else? Some big long family name, maybe?
AD_Bursar_Guards_Banter_10.context: NodeContext: Probing - he's absolutely certain 'Elliot' isn't any orc's real name

AD_Bursar_Guards_Banter_5.speaker: Elliot
AD_Bursar_Guards_Banter_5.text: Hm. Doubt you'd be able to pronounce it.
AD_Bursar_Guards_Banter_5.context: NodeContext: Playing along for a second

AD_Bursar_Guards_Banter_3.speaker: Elliot
AD_Bursar_Guards_Banter_3.text: Because if you ask me one more stupid question, I'll stand on your throat.
AD_Bursar_Guards_Banter_3.context: NodeContext: Flat threat to close the topic - no machoness to it, just fully stating a fact

AD_Bursar_Guards_Banter_6.speaker: Snapbone
AD_Bursar_Guards_Banter_6.text: Can't we set up in a better spot? It's bloody draughty here.

AD_Bursar_Guards_Banter_4.speaker: Elliot
AD_Bursar_Guards_Banter_4.text: That's the point. Uktar hardly wants his guards comfortable, now, does he?

Bursar_48.speaker: Uktar
Bursar_48.text: Uktar - I remain Guild bursar, whoever sits in the big chair. Do we have business?

Bursar_66.speaker: Uktar
Bursar_66.text: Uktar, bursar. If we have business, speak - Guild time is too precious to waste.

Bursar_70.speaker: Uktar
Bursar_70.text: You are not known to me. For supplies, seek the bugbear. To trade trinkets, the Fetcher's Brats.

Bursar_64.speaker: Uktar
Bursar_64.text: I am Uktar, duly elected Guild bursar, and I will not have my time wasted.

Bursar_71.speaker: Jaheira
Bursar_71.text: Is that what Nine-Fingers was doing, earlier? Wasting Guild time with this Stone Lord business?
Bursar_71.context: NodeContext: Probing, but not too obviously - she's insightful enough to draw people out on the things that bother them

Bursar_32.speaker: Uktar
Bursar_32.text: You might say so. I could not possibly comment.
Bursar_32.context: NodeContext: He would very much say so if he could

Bursar_42.speaker: Jaheira
Bursar_42.text: I sense there is no love lost between the two of you.
Bursar_42.context: NodeContext: Not an accusation, just an observation

Bursar_89.speaker: Player
Bursar_89.text: 'Uktar'. Ponder where you know the name from.

Bursar_72.speaker: Narrator
Bursar_72.text: *Uktar, eleventh month of the year - more commonly known as 'the Rotting', the time in which all things decay and die.*

Bursar_37.speaker: Narrator
Bursar_37.text: *Familiar as it sounds, the reference eludes you.*

Bursar_49.speaker: Player
Bursar_49.text: The Stone Lord is disrupting Guild business. Maybe you can help me fix that.

Bursar_27.speaker: Uktar
Bursar_27.text: By telling you where he is, in direct defiance of my guildmaster's orders?
Bursar_27.context: NodeContext: Eyebrow raised - he's not an idiot

Bursar_25.speaker: Uktar
Bursar_25.text: I have not come so far by being so foolish. The city has weathered crises before, and the Guild coffers along with it. Try someone else.

Bursar_13.speaker: Player
Bursar_13.text: You're no fan of Nine-Fingers. Tell me her plans for the Stone Lord.

Bursar_11.speaker: Uktar
Bursar_11.text: Whatever face you believe lies beneath this mask, I assure you it is not that of a gaping fool.

Bursar_61.speaker: Player
Bursar_61.text: You're named after the Rotting. Something to do with the mask?

Bursar_44.speaker: Uktar
Bursar_44.text: A... gift from Nine-Fingers. She has a penchant for literal names, and her cronies ensured it stuck.
Bursar_44.context: NodeContext: Gritted teeth - he does not like Nine-Fingers, but still works for her

Bursar_14.speaker: Player
Bursar_14.text: I sense there's no love lost between you and the guildmaster.

Bursar_26.speaker: Uktar
Bursar_26.text: Do you. How interesting. Now do we have business, or no?

Bursar_80.speaker: Uktar
Bursar_80.text: I need not love to serve. You have a point you wish to make?

Bursar_33.speaker: Player
Bursar_33.text: The quicker I deal with the Stone Lord, the quicker Nine-Fingers gets back to business.

Bursar_57.speaker: Uktar
Bursar_57.text: I have not come so far by indulging in petty disputes. But... I am open to transactions of mutual benefit.
Bursar_57.context: NodeContext: He doesn't care about personal insults, even though he dislikes NIneFingers. But he WILL help us if we help him

Bursar_96.speaker: Uktar
Bursar_96.text: I told you that I wish to acquire keys to the Counting House vaults. I suspect that what you seek might also be found down there.

Bursar_10.speaker: Uktar
Bursar_10.text: But who knows. You will have to take it upon yourself to go there and find out.
Bursar_10.context: NodeContext: Shrugging - he's given us the info we need, he's not going to do any more

Bursar_68.speaker: Jaheira
Bursar_68.text: She plans to ambush Minsc at the Counting House? But what the hells would he want there?

Bursar_9.speaker: Uktar
Bursar_9.text: I am interested in gaining access to vaults beneath the Counting House. I pay well for keys to those vaults. Provided said vaults are not emptied prematurely, of course.
Bursar_9.context: NodeContext: First and only moment of him taking us into his confidence. He wants something.

Bursar_4.speaker: Uktar
Bursar_4.text: I suspect that what you seek might also be found beneath the Counting House. I tell you this only as a matter of mutual interest.
Bursar_4.context: NodeContext: Telling us where Minsc is while maintaing deniability that he ever said it

Bursar_84.speaker: Uktar
Bursar_84.text: What you do with that information is a matter for yourself. Now, back to vault keys - do we have business to conduct?
Bursar_84.context: NodeContext: Telling us where Minsc is while maintaing deniability that he ever said it

Bursar_17.speaker: Uktar
Bursar_17.text: I clearly recall asking you not to waste my time.

Bursar_78.speaker: Uktar
Bursar_78.text: Then we are wasting one another's time.

Bursar_65.speaker: Uktar
Bursar_65.text: Yes. That is why I am smiling.
Bursar_65.context: NodeContext: Deadpan, not rising to our bait. He wears a smiling silver mask that hides his face.

Bursar_90.speaker: Player
Bursar_90.text: Do you always take yourself so seriously, Uktar?

Bursar_86.speaker: Uktar
Bursar_86.text: It is Guild business I take seriously, as you ought to. That business is finance.

Bursar_8.speaker: Player
Bursar_8.text: Bursar - is that a fancy word for thieves' accountant?

Bursar_22.speaker: Uktar
Bursar_22.text: I do not hand out loans, if that is what you're asking. My business is finance.
Bursar_22.context: NodeContext: Telling us where Minsc is while maintaing deniability that he ever said it

Bursar_62.speaker: Uktar
Bursar_62.text: Specifically - the acquisition of vault keys. The wealthy squirrel their riches away in the city's Counting House, where it gathers dust, serving no one.
Bursar_62.context: NodeContext: First and only hint of contempt / true emotion slipping through

Bursar_24.speaker: Uktar
Bursar_24.text: I acquire keys and allow these funds to circulate, like lifeblood in a healthy body. Everyone benefits - particularly those who bring me such keys.
Bursar_24.context: NodeContext: First and only hint of contempt / true emotion slipping through

Bursar_7.speaker: Uktar
Bursar_7.text: So. Are you wasting my time, or do you seek to benefit?

Bursar_21.speaker: Uktar
Bursar_21.text: The great wizard. I will be interested to see what manner of curiosities he deems worth locking away.

Bursar_34.speaker: Uktar
Bursar_34.text: A fine and noble house. Their funds will serve the city, as they would wish.
Bursar_34.context: NodeContext: Officious, knows we stole it

Bursar_97.speaker: Uktar
Bursar_97.text: Ah. A rather ancient patron of the Counting House. He has accrued quite a bit of interest, I'd wager.

Bursar_69.speaker: Uktar
Bursar_69.text: Ah, the would-be Duke! I'm sure he parted with it on good terms.

Bursar_54.speaker: Uktar
Bursar_54.text: The returning hero of Elturel. He's the philanthropic sort, so I'll assume this was a gift, yes?
Bursar_54.context: NodeContext: Not looking too far into where we got the key

Bursar_60.speaker: Uktar
Bursar_60.text: A most peculiar key to have in your possession. I wonder who it belongs to.
Bursar_60.context: NodeContext: Dry, faux innocence. You've just sold him the property of his boss - but he great dislikes her, and happily buys it

Bursar_43.speaker: Uktar
Bursar_43.text: DeVir. Now what would a servant of Lady Loss be so keen on keeping safe?

Bursar_91.speaker: Uktar
Bursar_91.text: Glitterbeard. He was given mastery of the Counting House over me, you know. Well deserved, wouldn't you say?
Bursar_91.context: NodeContext: Smug satisfaction - Glitterbeard is a rival

Bursar_30.speaker: Player
Bursar_30.text: I've given you everything I have.

Bursar_81.speaker: Uktar
Bursar_81.text: Then our business is done, for now.

Bursar_19.speaker: Player
Bursar_19.text: I have no keys to sell right now.

Bursar_41.speaker: Uktar
Bursar_41.context: NodeContext: Deadpan, uninterested in our curiousity about his mask

Bursar_88.speaker: Uktar
Bursar_88.text: Uktar, Guild bursar. Do we have business?

Bodyguard_001_0.speaker: Lady Ague
Bodyguard_001_0.text: We serve her still, and so do you.
Bodyguard_001_0.context: NodeContext: Spoken like a loyal soldier's mantra

Bodyguard_001_1.speaker: Lady Ague
Bodyguard_001_1.text: Don't mind the Lady's Court. Just playing a new game - what we'd call you if you joined our ranks. Way you're going, we just might let you.

Bodyguard_001_2.speaker: Lady Ague
Bodyguard_001_2.text: Don't mind the Lady's Court. Just a game we play - figuring how we'll kill you if you cross Nine-Fingers.

Bodyguard_001_5.speaker: Lady Ague
Bodyguard_001_5.text: Don't mind the Lady's Court. Just playing our last game - our warning to any who presume to take Nine-Fingers' place.
Bodyguard_001_5.context: NodeContext: Bitter - repeating the same phrase she always has, but with the edge that now the boss to whom she was fiercely loyal is now dead.

AD_Roah_TakeoverCancelled_MostMenDead_0.speaker: Roah Moonglow
AD_Roah_TakeoverCancelled_MostMenDead_0.text: What the hells? There aren't enough of us left to seal the deal... Shit.
AD_Roah_TakeoverCancelled_MostMenDead_0.context: NodeContext: Reflecting to herself that there aren't enough soldiers left for her to launch the coup she was planning.

AD_Roah_Combat_04_0.speaker: Roah Moonglow
AD_Roah_Combat_04_0.text: Push, Zhentarim! You only get what you take!
AD_Roah_Combat_04_0.context: NodeContext: Mid-battle, relishing the fight, egging on her soldiers

BossFriol_10.speaker: Boss Friol
BossFriol_10.text: You made it out of the sewers, I see. Cool your heels a moment, and let's talk.

BossFriol_7.speaker: Boss Friol
BossFriol_7.text: Nine-Fingers is done. My Zhentarim stand ready to purge this place of everyone loyal to her.

BossFriol_22.speaker: Boss Friol
BossFriol_22.text: So all I need to know is - does that include you, or not?

BossFriol_26.speaker: Player
BossFriol_26.text: Why are the Zhentarim working for the cult? They want everyone dead.

BossFriol_4.speaker: Boss Friol
BossFriol_4.text: Aye, not ideal. But we don't plan on going along with that - only on taking the opportunity this whole situation offers.

BossFriol_6.speaker: Boss Friol
BossFriol_6.text: The Zhentarim have been trying to crack Baldur's Gate for years, but Nine-Fingers' grip has been too strong. And look what it's come to.

BossFriol_41.speaker: Boss Friol
BossFriol_41.text: Her Guild is disorganised. Undisciplined. The cult broke them in a matter of days, while my Zhentarim still stand strong.

BossFriol_15.speaker: Boss Friol
BossFriol_15.text: A Guild under our control can do what Nine-Fingers failed to - drive the Absolute out of the city, once and for all.

BossFriol_29.speaker: Boss Friol
BossFriol_29.text: I've seen enough to know you want the Absolute booted out of the city - same as I do. No reason we can't work together.

BossFriol_35.speaker: Player
BossFriol_35.text: Enough talking. Get out of my way, or die.

BossFriol_40.speaker: Boss Friol
BossFriol_40.text: You don't know good sense when you hear it. But fine - have it your way.

BossFriol_5.speaker: Boss Friol
BossFriol_5.text: Zhentarim! Anyone who isn't us, dies!
BossFriol_5.context: NodeContext: Shouting to her troops to launch an attack

BossFriol_13.speaker: Player
BossFriol_13.text: All right. Let's deal with Nine-Fingers.

BossFriol_43.speaker: Boss Friol
BossFriol_43.text: Do you know - it's a genuine pleasure to deal with someone with a bit of sense in their head.

BossFriol_39.speaker: Boss Friol
BossFriol_39.text: TO ARMS, ZHENTARIM - THE GUILD IS OURS FOR THE TAKING!
BossFriol_39.context: NodeContext: Shouting to her troops to launch an attack

BossFriol_0.speaker: Player
BossFriol_0.text: That depends. What are you offering me?

BossFriol_28.speaker: Boss Friol
BossFriol_28.text: A better ally than the one you've got in Nine-Fingers.

BossFriol_14.speaker: Player
BossFriol_14.text: I'm loyal to whoever can help me save this city.

BossFriol_8.speaker: Boss Friol
BossFriol_8.text: Then look no further. The Zhentarim can protect the city - but only with Nine-Fingers out of the way.

BossFriol_42.speaker: Player
BossFriol_42.text: You're not talking me into anything. Get out of my way, or die.

BossFriol_12.speaker: Boss Friol
BossFriol_12.text: The Zhentarim will be busy putting order on this place for a while. But when you call for us, we'll come.

BossFriol_33.speaker: Boss Friol
BossFriol_33.text: Whiff of the sewers about you. You're the one eavesdropped on my private business dealings, I suppose?
BossFriol_33.context: NodeContext: Sizing us up - knows we saw her in a compromising situation, taking money to betray Nine-Fingers

BossFriol_32.speaker: Boss Friol
BossFriol_32.text: Whatever you think you heard, whatever you're here to do - cool your heels a moment. Let's talk.
BossFriol_32.context: NodeContext: Non-chalant - confident she can still turn this to her advantage.

BossFriol_44.speaker: Boss Friol
BossFriol_44.text: Not the fanciest office I've ever had, but it'll do.

BossFriol_20.speaker: Boss Friol
BossFriol_20.text: That was an unfortunate bit of business - but you handled yourself well. My thanks.

BossFriol_19.speaker: Boss Friol
BossFriol_19.text: New coat of paint, I think. Then we introduce ourselves to the local vermin - let them know there's been a change of management.

BossFriol_3.speaker: Player
BossFriol_3.text: I'm still not entirely clear what I get out of this deal.

BossFriol_18.speaker: Boss Friol
BossFriol_18.text: Besides that dragon's hoard you got from the Counting House?

BossFriol_11.speaker: Boss Friol
BossFriol_11.text: But don't worry. We'll be at your back when it comes time to boot the Absolute out.
BossFriol_11.context: NodeContext: 'Sword captain' is a reference to herself - a faux-humble 'yours truly', as she's sure she'll get a promotion

BossFriol_16.speaker: Boss Friol
BossFriol_16.text: Might be I'll even be flaunting a shiny new rank. I just handed my superiors quite the catch.

BossFriol_1.speaker: Boss Friol
BossFriol_1.text: Aye, and I'm grateful. Baldur's Gate was the last city along the coast that we hadn't quite put our bootprint on.

BossFriol_25.speaker: Boss Friol
BossFriol_25.text: We're here to stay, now. And when the battle-horns start blowing, you'll see we're as good as our word.

BossFriol_17.speaker: Boss Friol
BossFriol_17.context: NodeContext: Faux-formality, with a little bow. She does mean it, but she's toying with us a little bit - we've just seen firsthand that she has no problem going back on her word.

BossFriol_46.speaker: Player
BossFriol_46.text: And you only had to collaborate with a death-cult to do it. Your superiors won't mind?

BossFriol_24.speaker: Boss Friol
BossFriol_24.text: Hah. They all did the same or worse - that's how they got to be my superiors.

BossFriol_21.speaker: Player
BossFriol_21.text: Why does the Zhentarim care so much about Baldur's Gate?

BossFriol_30.speaker: Boss Friol
BossFriol_30.text: Simple enough - because it wasn't ours. Couldn't be, so long as Nine-Fingers was around.

BossFriol_34.speaker: Boss Friol
BossFriol_34.text: Now the Guild can become a Zhent operation - and we'll have your back when the battle-horns start blowing. I'm as good as my word.

BossFriol_37.speaker: Player
BossFriol_37.text: Don't thank me too soon. This isn't your office - it's mine.

BossFriol_27.speaker: Boss Friol
BossFriol_27.text: Could've just kept things simple, mate. But fine - have it your way. You're just another corpse to step over.
BossFriol_27.context: NodeContext: Sighing, tired - not bothered we're betraying her, just inconvenienced at the extra work

AD_BossFriol_Patrol_14.speaker: Boss Friol
AD_BossFriol_Patrol_14.text: |Alright, I'll be checking in again soon.|

AD_BossFriol_Patrol_12.speaker: Boss Friol
AD_BossFriol_Patrol_12.text: |Why is Follgast not on his post?|

AD_NineFingers_DuringCoup_0.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
AD_NineFingers_DuringCoup_0.text: What's all this now, Zhent? The city's ransom I'm paying you not enough?
AD_NineFingers_DuringCoup_0.context: NodeContext: Calling out to opposing leader who's in the process of betraying her.

AD_NineFingers_DuringCoup_1.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
AD_NineFingers_DuringCoup_1.text: Easy! Any Guild member strikes the first blow, it won't be the Zhentarim that kills 'em.
AD_NineFingers_DuringCoup_1.context: NodeContext: Calling out to her assembled

Roah_4.speaker: Roah Moonglow
Roah_4.text: Whatever you're planning to do to take down the Absolute - do it before that little worm of yours claims you.

Roah_5.speaker: Roah Moonglow
Roah_5.text: Hm. Are you, by any chance, the bad smell that followed me up from the sewer?
Roah_5.context: NodeContext: Sizing us up - knows we saw her in a compromising situation, taking money to betray Nine-Fingers

Roah_15.speaker: Roah Moonglow
