Roah_15.text: Whatever you saw, cool your heels a moment. Let's talk.
Roah_15.context: NodeContext: Non-chalant - confident she can still turn this to her advantage.

Roah_33.speaker: Roah Moonglow
Roah_33.text: Nine-Fingers is done. My Zhentarim stand ready to purge this place of everyone loyal to her.

Roah_37.speaker: Roah Moonglow
Roah_37.text: So all I need to know is - does that include you, or not?

Roah_39.speaker: Player
Roah_39.text: Why are you working for the cult? They want to enslave everyone.

Roah_36.speaker: Roah Moonglow
Roah_36.text: You fail to see the bigger picture. Yes - they offered us money but more than that, they offered an opportunity. The money is a bonus.

Roah_23.speaker: Roah Moonglow
Roah_23.text: The Zhentarim have been trying to crack Baldur's Gate for years, but Nine-Fingers' grip has been too strong. And look what it's come to.

Roah_29.speaker: Roah Moonglow
Roah_29.text: Her Guild is disorganised. Undisciplined. The cult broke them in a matter of days, while my Zhentarim still stand strong.

Roah_20.speaker: Roah Moonglow
Roah_20.text: A Guild under our control can do what Nine-Fingers failed to - drive the Absolute out of the city, once and for all.

Roah_31.speaker: Roah Moonglow
Roah_31.text: We're all on the same side. If there are spoils to be split afterwards, well... I'm sure there's enough to share.

Roah_9.speaker: Player
Roah_9.text: Enough talking. Get out of my way, or die.

Roah_25.speaker: Roah Moonglow
Roah_25.text: Hah, a hero. There's a time for heroics, my friend, and a time for common sense. This was the latter.

Roah_12.speaker: Roah Moonglow
Roah_12.text: To arms, Zhentarim! The Guild is ours - once we clear out the vermin!
Roah_12.context: NodeContext: Shouting to her troops to launch an attack

Roah_30.speaker: Player
Roah_30.text: All right. We're indeed on the same side. Let's deal with Nine-Fingers.

Roah_7.speaker: Roah Moonglow
Roah_7.text: TO ARMS, ZHENTARIM - THE GUILD IS OURS FOR THE TAKING!
Roah_7.context: NodeContext: Shouting to her troops to launch an attack

Roah_42.speaker: Player
Roah_42.text: That depends. What are you offering me?

Roah_43.speaker: Roah Moonglow
Roah_43.text: A more dependable ally than the current guildmaster.

Roah_47.speaker: Player
Roah_47.text: I'm loyal to whoever can help me save this city.

Roah_0.speaker: Roah Moonglow
Roah_0.text: Then look no further. The Zhentarim can protect the city - but only with Nine-Fingers out of the way.

Roah_16.speaker: Player
Roah_16.text: You're not talking me into anything. Get out of my way, or die.

Roah_13.speaker: Roah Moonglow
Roah_13.text: My new office. The chair could be a little comfier, and the desk definitely needs adjusting - but I'd say it'll do.

Roah_46.speaker: Roah Moonglow
Roah_46.text: A deal well done. Congratulations all around.

Roah_27.speaker: Roah Moonglow
Roah_27.text: Hm. I redecorate, I think. This place could do with some Zhentarim banners. Then we prepare.

Roah_34.speaker: Player
Roah_34.text: I'm still not entirely clear what I get out of it.

Roah_19.speaker: Roah Moonglow
Roah_19.text: Besides that dragon's hoard you got from the Counting House?

Roah_44.speaker: Roah Moonglow
Roah_44.text: When it comes time to fight the Absolute, you'll have a private army at your beck and call. With a newly-minted Sword-captain at its head, I suspect.
Roah_44.context: NodeContext: 'Sword captain' is a reference to herself - a faux-humble 'yours truly', as she's sure she'll get a promotion

Roah_38.speaker: Roah Moonglow
Roah_38.text: The Network has been looking for a toe-hold in this city for years, and I just gave them the whole damn leg-up.

Roah_48.speaker: Roah Moonglow
Roah_48.text: It's been a fruitful partnership, no doubt. Without Nine-Fingers clogging up the works, the Zhentarim have a clear run of the cities on the coast now.

Roah_51.speaker: Player
Roah_51.text: And you only had to collaborate with a death-cult to do it. Your superiors won't mind?

Roah_21.speaker: Roah Moonglow
Roah_21.text: I did what I was trained to - spotted the balance of power shifting, and nudged where I needed to make sure it fell our way.

Roah_28.speaker: Roah Moonglow
Roah_28.text: You benefit too, don't forget. Go pick a fight with this god - we'll be there when you need us.

Roah_2.speaker: Roah Moonglow
Roah_2.context: NodeContext: Faux-formality, with a little bow. She does mean it, but she's toying with us a little bit - we've just seen firsthand that she has no problem going back on her word.

Roah_35.speaker: Player
Roah_35.text: Why does the Zhentarim care so much about Baldur's Gate?

Roah_24.speaker: Roah Moonglow
Roah_24.text: Trade, why else? That gap-handed wench and her Guild held their monopoly for far too long.

Roah_45.speaker: Roah Moonglow
Roah_45.text: Now the Guild can become a Zhent operation - and we'll have your back when the battle-horns start blowing.

Roah_11.speaker: Player
Roah_11.text: The deal's not done yet. As it happens, I'd like to take this office for myself.

Roah_14.speaker: Roah Moonglow
Roah_14.text: Betraying me? But, but... we had a deal.
Roah_14.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mock-whining and cringing - she saw this betrayal coming a long way offNodeContext: Mock-whining and cringing - she saw this betrayal coming a long way off

Roah_40.speaker: Roah Moonglow
Roah_40.text: Fair enough. Can't say I'd have done different - though I think I'd have picked my moment a little better.

Roah_32.speaker: Roah Moonglow
Roah_32.text: Ah - you survived. Which means my employers are dead, I take it? No matter - gives us a chance to talk.

AD_Zhent_Mercenary_006_DuringCoup_0.speaker: Phase
AD_Zhent_Mercenary_006_DuringCoup_0.context: NodeContext: Agitated, adrenaline high waiting for order to attack and not sure what you're saying.

Zhent_Agent001_15.speaker: Rugan
Zhent_Agent001_15.text: Back on duty in a moment. Just... a moment.

Zhent_Agent001_22.speaker: Rugan
Zhent_Agent001_22.text: If you're wondering what we strapping Zhentarim are doing in a dump like this - that makes two of us, friend.

Zhent_Agent001_4.speaker: Rugan
Zhent_Agent001_4.text: Everyone, look! This is the one that delivered my soft and downy bum from a pack of gnolls!

Zhent_Agent001_1.speaker: Rugan
Zhent_Agent001_1.text: Aaand... nobody gives a shite. Should've left me there, mate - it would've been a kinder death than the others got.

Zhent_Agent001_10.speaker: Player
Zhent_Agent001_10.text: Kinder than being torn apart by a pack of gnolls?

Zhent_Agent001_50.speaker: Rugan
Zhent_Agent001_50.text: Well. Maybe the wine has clouded my wits a bit there. But the others were hanged - a nasty way to go.

Zhent_Agent001_30.speaker: Player
Zhent_Agent001_30.text: The other Zhentarim? What happened to them?

Zhent_Agent001_11.speaker: Rugan
Zhent_Agent001_11.text: I'm not drunk. I've been drinking - and you would be too, if you'd seen what I have. The others were hanged.

Zhent_Agent001_8.speaker: Rugan
Zhent_Agent001_8.text: We returned to find new management among the Zhentarim in the city. They promptly turned us all over to the Steel Watch.

Zhent_Agent001_19.speaker: Rugan
Zhent_Agent001_19.text: Justice for that caravanserai and the kidnapped duke, apparently. Funny that we'd get done for the one bit of mischief that wasn't ours.

Zhent_Agent001_23.speaker: Rugan
Zhent_Agent001_23.text: Either way, the new management didn't want the Watch looking our way. So the others were served up on a platter - an offering.

Zhent_Agent001_17.speaker: Player
Zhent_Agent001_17.text: So how is it you're still alive?

Zhent_Agent001_45.speaker: Rugan
Zhent_Agent001_45.text: How d'you think? I turned informer. Fed every lie and accusation back to them: 'Yes, sir - I saw them do it all.'

Zhent_Agent001_40.speaker: Rugan
Zhent_Agent001_40.text: I showed loyalty, so I got to walk away. As a - whatsit - a cautionary tale.

Zhent_Agent001_43.speaker: Player
Zhent_Agent001_43.text: You certainly smell like a cautionary tale, Rugan.

Zhent_Agent001_36.speaker: Rugan
Zhent_Agent001_36.text: What can I say? I am exacting in my duty.
Zhent_Agent001_36.context: NodeContext: Rhetorical intonation: "What can I say."

Zhent_Agent001_32.speaker: Rugan
Zhent_Agent001_32.text: No idea. But whatever they're planning has impressed the powers-that-be at Darkhold, judging by the reinforcements.

Zhent_Agent001_47.speaker: Player
Zhent_Agent001_47.text: And after all that, you're still working for the Zhentarim?

Zhent_Agent001_20.speaker: Rugan
Zhent_Agent001_20.text: 'Course. I'm owed back-pay. Not that there's much for me to do that these reinforcements from Darkhold don't have covered.

Zhent_Agent001_2.speaker: Rugan
Zhent_Agent001_2.text: As the last of the original Gate crew, my duty is to drink to fallen comrades. So... if'n you don't mind?

Zhent_Agent001_0.speaker: Player
Zhent_Agent001_0.text: The Zhentarim have brought you nothing but trouble, Rugan. Cut your losses.

Zhent_Agent001_39.speaker: Rugan
Zhent_Agent001_39.text: Losses, mate? What exactly have I got left to lose? They won't even give me a post here.

Zhent_Agent001_41.speaker: Rugan
Zhent_Agent001_41.text: Aye. Aye, maybe you're right. Consider me officially off-duty.

Zhent_Agent001_46.speaker: Rugan
Zhent_Agent001_46.text: I've been Black Network for as long as I remember. I've been loyal. Few bumps in the road don't change that.

Zhent_Agent001_3.speaker: Rugan
Zhent_Agent001_3.text: So if you don't mind - give me a little space, civilian.

Zhent_Agent001_13.speaker: Player
Zhent_Agent001_13.text: The Zhentarim sold your friends out. You think they wouldn't do the same to you?

Zhent_Agent001_42.speaker: Rugan
Zhent_Agent001_42.text: Not if there was no profit in it, no. But then... our kind can find profit in anything.

Zhent_Agent001_34.speaker: Player
Zhent_Agent001_34.text: The Zhentarim made you turn on your people. You really think you owe them loyalty?

Zhent_Agent001_33.speaker: Rugan
Zhent_Agent001_33.text: There's no 'owing' with the Zhentarim, mate. There's just taking. Whoever's quickest, and meanest, and...

Zhent_Agent001_12.speaker: Rugan
Zhent_Agent001_12.text: I'm... tired. Reckon I'll take a break. Go... off duty for a while.

Zhent_Agent001_18.speaker: Rugan
Zhent_Agent001_18.text: Oh, aye. I'm all luck these days, my friend.

Zhent_Agent001_44.speaker: Rugan
Zhent_Agent001_44.text: To Ronnie... Ozzy... What the hells was his name...?

Zhent_Agent001_48.speaker: Rugan
Zhent_Agent001_48.text: Wha...? Was there a fight or something?

AD_BossFriol_TakeoverCancelled_AllMenDea.speaker: Boss Friol
AD_BossFriol_TakeoverCancelled_AllMenDea.text: Stlarning shit. What happened to all my soldiers? May have to change plans...

Zhent_Mercenary_001_1.speaker: Slick Inatra
Zhent_Mercenary_001_1.text: The Guild ain't gone, for what it's worth. If I know the boss, well... we're just restructuring.

Zhent_Mercenary_001_2.speaker: Slick Inatra
Zhent_Mercenary_001_2.text: Don't give me that squinty side-eye like all these paranoid Guildies.
Zhent_Mercenary_001_2.context: NodeContext: Friendly, amused at the suspicion you're receiving around here. You're a mercenary company, but you are here to help.

Zhent_Mercenary_001_31.speaker: Slick Inatra
Zhent_Mercenary_001_31.text: Nine-Fingers is well-respected in the Zhentarim. If the Stone Lord's pressing in on her territory, we're here to help.

Zhent_Mercenary_001_16.speaker: Player
Zhent_Mercenary_001_16.text: I have business with the Zhentarim.

Zhent_Mercenary_001_34.speaker: Player
Zhent_Mercenary_001_34.text: How does the Guild feel about you pressing in on their territory?

Zhent_Mercenary_001_29.speaker: Slick Inatra
Zhent_Mercenary_001_29.text: Missed the welcome parade, did you? Hugging, tears - it was just lovely.

Zhent_Mercenary_001_10.speaker: Slick Inatra
Zhent_Mercenary_001_10.text: True, we've been better-liked in towns we bloody conquered - but it's hard to blame Nine-Fingers.

Zhent_Mercenary_001_14.speaker: Slick Inatra
Zhent_Mercenary_001_14.text: On top, undisputed, for years. Then you have to call the likes of us in to protect you from some shithead calling himself 'Stone Lord'. I'd be embarrassed, too.

Zhent_Mercenary_001_24.speaker: Player
Zhent_Mercenary_001_24.text: Whatever the Zhentarim's business with Nine-Fingers, I have my own to conduct.

Zhent_Mercenary_001_25.speaker: Slick Inatra
Zhent_Mercenary_001_25.text: That so? Go on, then - entertain me. The Guildhall isn't much fun these days.

Zhent_Mercenary_001_21.speaker: Player
Zhent_Mercenary_001_21.text: Consider me an honorary Zhentarim. I was given this package to deliver.

Zhent_Mercenary_001_9.speaker: Slick Inatra
Zhent_Mercenary_001_9.text: Well, you can't be Zhentarim, mate - because Zhentarim don't go poking around in their cargo.

Zhent_Mercenary_001_27.speaker: Slick Inatra
Zhent_Mercenary_001_27.text: The ones who were supposed to carry this are already dead. Better you don't ask - new Zhentarim leadership in the city.

Zhent_Mercenary_001_15.speaker: Slick Inatra
Zhent_Mercenary_001_15.text: I don't fancy reporting a botched shipment - and I doubt you fancy dying on the rack. So... what shipment?
Zhent_Mercenary_001_15.context: NodeContext: Playing dumb, cutting off the conversation - urging us to do the same.

Zhent_Mercenary_001_26.speaker: Player
Zhent_Mercenary_001_26.text: Consider me an honorary Zhentarim. I was given this package to deliver.

Zhent_Mercenary_001_5.speaker: Slick Inatra
Zhent_Mercenary_001_5.text: Look at you! There was mention of a shipment on the way.

Zhent_Mercenary_001_30.speaker: Slick Inatra
Zhent_Mercenary_001_30.text: But your deal was with the Zhentarim themselves - and you delivered. Here - I hope it's generous enough. We've just landed a Guild contract, after all.
Zhent_Mercenary_001_30.context: NodeContext: easy-going, friendly - despite having just related the horrible fates of the OTHER Zhent we were dealing with,

Zhent_Mercenary_001_13.speaker: Slick Inatra
Zhent_Mercenary_001_13.text: No, mate. That can't be right. See - no one would be dumb enough to open Zhentarim cargo.

Zhent_Mercenary_001_4.speaker: Slick Inatra
Zhent_Mercenary_001_4.text: Far as I'm concerned, the deal you made with the boss holds. 'Til I hear otherwise, anyway.

Zhent_Mercenary_001_7.speaker: Slick Inatra
Zhent_Mercenary_001_7.text: I meant it when I said I respected Keene. I don't have to like my orders, just follow 'em.

Zhent_Mercenary_001_20.speaker: Slick Inatra
Zhent_Mercenary_001_20.text: Well. Made something of a mess, didn't we? My crew and I won't stop you tidying it up - not 'til we get some fresh orders from headquarters.

Zhent_Mercenary_001_22.speaker: Slick Inatra
Zhent_Mercenary_001_22.text: Guild roof, Guild rules. I'll make sure my people know that.

Zhent_Mercenary_001_23.speaker: Slick Inatra
Zhent_Mercenary_001_23.text: The Black Network cares. Just so happens that we charge, too.
Zhent_Mercenary_001_23.context: NodeContext: Sincere, as if repeating a company motto she actually believes. Second line is her own addtion.

Zhent_Mercenary_001_33.speaker: Slick Inatra
Zhent_Mercenary_001_33.text: Get used to us. I hear Nine-Fingers' hunt is not going well - she needs us now more than ever.

Bursar_Guard_001_1.speaker: Snapbone
Bursar_Guard_001_1.text: What are you looking at? I'm no traitor - was Uktar swore to Nine-Fingers, not me.
Bursar_Guard_001_1.context: NodeContext: A little defensive. The Guildmaster was just bloodily deposed, and his faction didn't align with her - though he personally would have liked to.

Bursar_Guard_001_2.speaker: Snapbone
Bursar_Guard_001_2.text: Work to do - you and me both.

Bursar_Guard_001_3.speaker: Snapbone
Bursar_Guard_001_3.text: Don't go mistaking us for Zhentarim. Uktar's his own outfit - so it's business as usual.

Bursar_Guard_001_4.speaker: Snapbone
Bursar_Guard_001_4.text: Don't know what Keene was thinking, inviting Zhentarim in in the first place. Like trying to leash a bloody viper.

Bursar_Guard_001_5.speaker: Snapbone
Bursar_Guard_001_5.text: Nothing quite like standing on Zhentish necks to improve a man's mood.

Bursar_Guard_001_6.speaker: Snapbone
Bursar_Guard_001_6.text: Don't let him fool you. Uktar's actually quite a cheerful sort, behind the mask.

Bursar_Guard_001_7.speaker: Snapbone
Bursar_Guard_001_7.text: You might call yourself boss now, boss, but it's still Uktar I answer to.

Bursar_Guard_001_8.speaker: Snapbone
Bursar_Guard_001_8.text: Your eyes are going to want to wander over all this gold. S'only natural.

Bursar_Guard_001_0.speaker: Snapbone
Bursar_Guard_001_0.text: Just make sure it stops at your eyes, aye?
